title: mortarion
body:
From [[Warhammer 40K]]. Mortarion is the [[Primarch]] of the XIVth (14) [[adeptus_astartes|Legiones Astartes]], the [[Death Guard]]. He aligned himself with the Traitors during the Horus Heresy, and worships [[Nurgle]], the [[chaos (warhammer)|Chaos God]] of decay and disease. Having been tricked by his First Captain Calas Typhon to travelling into the heart of Nurgle's Realm, he was forced to pledge his allegiance to the god to save his sons from the Destroyer Plague, turning them into [[plague_marine|Plague Marines]] and him into a [[demon_primarch|Daemon]] [[daemon_prince|Prince]] of Nurgle. His signature weapon is the Chain [[Scythe]], [[Silence (weapon)|]].

h4. Official art
* !asset #19884472: Ancient remembrancer sketch
* !asset #19884173: Before being corrupted by Nurgle
* !post #6753587: As a [[demon primarch]]

title: pelvic_lift
body: An exercise in which the person lies on their back with knees bent and raises their pelvis off the floor. It strengthens the [[abs]], glutes, and lower back, as well as the pelvic floor. As such, physical therapists often prescribe it to treat back pain and bladder control problems.

title: sheath
body:
Scabbard, a container for a [[sword]] or other large blade. If it is a container for a gun use [[holster]] instead.

* When the sheath contains a weapon, use [[sheathed]].
* When the weapon is partially sheathed, consider using [[unsheathing]].
* When the sheath is visible but the weapon is completely out of the sheath already, use [[unsheathed]].
* Weapons covered in a cloth bag should use [[weapon bag]] instead.

title: houseki_no_kuni
body:
[b]Houseki no Kuni[/b] (宝石の国, lit. "Country of Jewels", English: "Land of the Lustrous") is an ongoing action/fantasy manga series. The series is written and illustrated by Haruko Ichikawa and has been published in Kodansha's [i]Afternoon[/i] magazine since December 2012.  The manga was on hiatus from December 2020 until June 2022.

Set in a world inhabited by "jewel people," it chronicles their efforts to find the place where they belong and defend their way of life.

An anime promotional video was released on July 2013. A 12 episode anime adaptation aired between October and December 2017.

h4. Characters

h6. Gems (Houseki)

A humanoid species made of gems that inhabit the land of the planet. There are 28 gems at the start of the story. They appear to be [[androgynous|genderless]].

title: vivienne_westwood
body:
Vivienne Westwood is a British [[fashion]] brand named after its founder by the same name. The logo and main symbol used in clothing, jewelry and accessories for the company is a [[globus cruciger]].

Despite being a British brand, Vivienne Westwood is very popular in Japan, especially in street and alternative fashion styles such as [[gyaru]] and [[punk]].

body: [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden|Magia Record]] character. A specimen of [[Kyubey]]'s race that only exists within Kamihama City, in which the game/anime adaptation is set. title: straight_razor
body:
A traditional [[razor]] with a long blade attached in a straight line with the handle.

The blade may be hinged with a case that opens to form the handle, or it may be fixed to a straight handle as in the traditional Japanese [i]kamisori[/i].

title: hair_clipper
body:
A tool used for [[cutting hair]]. A hair clipper generally comes with comb attachments for adjustable hair length and is not designed to shave as closely as an [[electric razor]] can.

The blades are arranged like "teeth" and cut by acting as many mini scissors.  Devices with smaller finer blades are typically marketed as "hair trimmers," while those with larger blades are marketed as "hair clippers."  The largest types are used on animals and are frequently referred to as "electric shears" or "mechanical shears."

h4. Examples

* !post #6707747
* !post #7575305

h4. See also

* [[electric razor]]
* [[cutting hair]]

title: safety_razor
body:
A [[razor]] that is designed to make [[shaving]] safer by attaching a protective device between the [[razor blade]] and the skin (as opposed to a [[straight razor]]).

This includes both traditional double-edge razors with disposable [[razor blade]]s, and modern razors with disposable cartridges or where the entire razor is disposable.

title: aquiline_nose
body:
An aquiline [[nose]], also called a Roman nose or hooked nose, is a type of [[nose]] which has a prominent bridge, giving the appearance of being bent or curved. [i]Aquiline[/i] comes from the Latin [i]aquilinus[/i], meaning "eagle-like", alluding to the curved beak-like shape of the nose. 

If the nose has a distinct slant at the top where it meets the face, or a prominent outwards curve, it should be tagged as such.

h4. Examples

* !post #7743174
* !post #3744374
* !post #1632086

title: matsuda_touta
body:

title: aizawa_shuuichi
body: A [[Death Note]] character, Aizawa is an intelligent, respected member of both the NPA and Task Force. He takes his work very seriously and chooses to work strictly within the law. Out of all the members in the Task Force, Aizawa is the most overtly skeptical, questioning [[L (Death note)|]]'s basis for his conclusions and expressing the most doubt in them, and often finds himself clashing and opposing many of L's ideas and actions. He has a wife, Eriko, and two children, including Yumi, his daughter, and his baby son, whose name is unknown. Due to him rarely being able to visit home during his work on the [[yagami light|Kira]] case, his personal life and relationship with his family becomes strained.

title: l_(death_note)
body:
An enigmatic genius detective and rival of the main character [[Yagami Light]] in the [[Death Note]] manga and anime series.

He is a [[pale skin|pale]] young man with messy [[black hair]] and [[empty eyes|empty]] [[black eyes]] with [[bags under eyes|bags]] under them. He likes [[sweets]] and is known to sit in bizarre positions.

He assumes various aliases to protect his identity, including the name "Ryuzaki" for most of the series. His real name is [spoiler]L Lawliet.[/spoiler]

title: near_(death_note)
body: Near, real name [spoiler]Nate River[/spoiler], is a protagonist of the series [[Death Note]] that appears after the death of the first protagonist, [[L (death_note)|]]. He appears to be a young genius. He has a habit of playing with toys.

title: uohhhhhhhhh!_(meme)
body:
An exclamation of excitement, usually about [[loli|little girls]]. Frequently accompanied by the [[crying emoji]] (😭) and the slang "[[cunny (meme)|]]".

It originated from a tweet made in spring 2020 by [[dorontabi]] under the handle [nodtext]@mammoth_2020[/nodtext]:

[quote]うおおおおああああああ！！！子供エロっ!!!!!!子供の腹と胸!!!!!!エロだ...😭😭😭
[tn]Translated from Japanese by Google:[/tn]
Uohhhhhhhhh! !! !! Child erotic !!!!!! Child's belly and chest !!!!!! Erotic … 😭😭😭 [/quote]

h4. See also
* [[cunny (meme)]]

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Uohhhhhhhhh! 😭":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/uohhhhhhhhh-%F0%9F%98%AD]

title: hachijou_tooya
body:
[b]Major spoilers below.[/b]

Character from [[Umineko no Naku Koro Ni]]. For [[Featherine Augustus Aurora]]'s human equivalent, see [[Hachijou Ikuko]].

[spoiler]"Hachijou Tooya" is [[Ushiromiya Battler]] following the murders on Rokkenjima, who lost his original memories by way of nearly drowning in an attempt to save [[yasu_(umineko)|Sayo Yasuda]]. He was later found by [[Hachijou Ikuko]] on the side of the road, and was able to bond with her over their love of mystery novels. Ikuko gave him his new name due to how he was eighteen (十, [i]tō[/i], ten, and 八, [i]ya[/i], eight) years old upon being found.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]After learning of Yasu's original forgeries from Ikuko, Tooya became unable to accept his original identity; due to both being the cause of painful headaches, and because Tooya became scared at the thought at having somebody else's memories. To cope with his past existence, he collaborated with Ikuko (who served as a ghost writer) to recreate the events of 1986 based on the forgeries; resulting in the framing device for most of Umineko itself.[/spoiler]

title: shiina_niki
body:
A character from [[Ensemble Stars!]] Music!

An [[idol]] who also works as a [[chef]]. He used to perform as part of a duo with [[Amagi rinne|Rinne Amagi]]. Though he's someone very easily swayed by the words of others, he has an overall chipper personality. He becomes wild and brusque once his stomach is empty. Normally, though, he has a friendly atmosphere about him and feels easy to talk to. With a mischievous voice, his performances are light and carefree.

Niki is a member of Cosmic Production's [[crazy b (ensemble stars!)|Crazy:B]].

H4. External Links
* "Ensemble Stars Fandom Wiki: Niki Shiina":[https://ensemble-stars.fandom.com/wiki/Niki_Shiina]

title: amagi_rinne
body:
A character from [[Ensemble Stars!]] Music!

An [[idol]] who lives and breathes his hobby, [[gambling]], and treats his life no different than one of those gambles. He used to perform as part of a duo with [[Shiina Niki|Niki Shiina]]. Though a cheerful and generous individual, there are times he can be not only wasteful, but downright tyrannical. He is [[Amagi Hiiro|Hiiro Amagi']]s older brother. He likes to test his luck. With a voice that's mischievous, as if he were playing some game, Rinne's performances are powerful and larger than life.

Rinne is a member of Cosmic Production's [[crazy b (ensemble stars!)|Crazy:B]].

H4. External Links
* "Ensemble Stars Fandom Wiki: Rinne Amagi":[https://ensemble-stars.fandom.com/wiki/Rinne_Amagi]

title: alice_mana
body:
Korean [[Indie virtual youtuber]] formerly part of [[paryi project]] and Korean VTuber group [[541 E&C]] (which later became a part of [[Nijisanji KR]], the merger prompting her departure). A monochrome [[kitsune]] with [[multicolored_hair|muticolored]] [[twintails]] dressed in traditional [[Japanese clothes]] that can switch from black to white and vice versa with multiple tails of the same colors (her original design she had two. Her redesign has four.).  

She originally debuted on May 9th, 2018. Her artist was [[paryi]] (when she was with 541 E&C her design was by Moarin) but on July 12, 2020 she re-debuted back on YouTube after previously streaming only on [[bilibili]] and [[twitch.tv]]. Her new design was drawn by [[nabi (uz02)|Nabi]] and her new rigging by [[keffiy]].

Interestingly, she has stated herself to be 315 years old yet her birthday falls on February 29, which is considered a "leap year":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leap_year

title: henry_rifle
body:
The progenitor of the more famous [[Winchester model 1866|Winchester rifles]], the Henry Repeating Rifle can be readily identified from them visually by the lack of a side-mounted loading gate, lack of a wooden forward stock, and yellow-colored bronze/brass alloy receiver. Though the Henry was used in some numbers during the [[American Civil War]] and the [[Boshin War]], the weapon would make its deepest mark in the American west, where it played a crucial role in the Battle of Little Bighorn.

* !post #8560683: A view of the various distinguishing features of the Henry.

title: colt_1860_army
body:
A .44 caliber cap and ball [[revolver]] designed by Samuel Colt in the 1850s, and the most common pistol used in the [[American Civil War]]. It uses the same frame as the [[Colt 1851 Navy]], but is visually distinguished by its larger size, and circular barrel as opposed to the 1851's hexagonal barrel.

title: em-2
body:
A prototype [[bullpup]] [b][[assault rifle]][/b] chambered in .280 British intermediate [[ammunition|cartridge]], the EM-2 was seriously considered for adoption by the [[British Army]] in the 1950s but was abandoned after NATO mandated all its members' rifles use the 7.62mm cartridge, which was too powerful for the EM-2 platform to contain. The [[weapon]] features a fixed [[optical sight]] on the carry [[handle]], wooden furniture, and a bulged handguard. 
Its design eventually influenced the [[L85|SA80]] [[rifle]].

In anime, the EM-2 is most often seen wielded by members of the [[Justice Task Force (Blue Archive)|Justice Task Force]] in [[Blue Archive]].

h1. See also

body: A boss fought on Chapter 11 of [[Kid Icarus Uprising]]. He is a large, sentient [[rock]] that acts as an enforcer of [[Viridi]]'s Forces of Nature. He has a weak spot on his backside.

body: The dog is a minor character that appears in the Chapter 18 of [[Kid Icarus Uprising]]. [[pit_(kid_icarus)|Pit]] briefly takes control of its body when his soul is trapped in the Ring of Chaos before taking control of [[magnus (kid icarus)|Magnus]].

title: magnus_(kid_icarus)
body:
A supporting character from [[Kid Icarus Uprising]], described as the most powerful human warrior who ever lived. His weapon of choice is the [[Magnus Club (kid_icarus)|]].
He befriends [[Pit (kid_icarus)|]] in Chapter 2, becomes playable temporarily in Chapter 18, and is fought along with [[Gaol]] in Chapter 24.

title: koihime_musou
body:
[b]Koihime Musou: Doki Otome Darake no Sangokushi Engi[/b] (lit. [i]Love Princess†Unmatched ~Throb☆Romance of Three Kingdoms Filled with Girls~[/i]) is a Japanese adult visual novel and strategy game based on the classic Chinese novel [[Romance of the Three Kingdoms]].

It was developed by [i]BaseSon[/i], and was first released on January 26, 2007, for the PC as two DVD-ROMs, followed by a re-release on April 11, 2008, containing an extra CD-ROM. A [[PlayStation 2]] version, titled [i]Koihime Musou[/i] (恋姫†夢想) developed by [i]Yeti[/i] and published by [i]Regista[/i] was released on October 30, 2008. A new version of [i]Koihime[/i] with many new characters titled [i]Shin Koihime Musou: Otome Ryouran Sangokushi Engi[/i] (真・恋姫†無双 〜乙女繚乱☆三国志演義〜) was released on December 26, 2008. A third version titled [i]Shin Koihime Musou: Moe Shouden[/i] (真・恋姫†無双～萌将伝～) was released on July 23, 2010.

A manga adaptation by Japanese illustrator [[Hizuki Yayoi]] was first serialized in the Japanese magazine [i]Dengeki G's Festival! Comic[/i] on April 26, 2008. An anime adaptation produced by [i]Doga Kobo[/i] began broadcasting on July 8, 2008, and several seasons have continued.

All characters are loosely based on characters of the novel [[Romance of the Three Kingdoms]] and are grouped in the faction/kingdom they belong to and called by their Japanese names.

title: solar_term
body:
A [b]solar term[/b] (or jiéqì, simplified Chinese: 节气; traditional Chinese: 節氣) is any of 24 periods in traditional Chinese calendars that matches a particular astronomical event or signifies some natural phenomenon. It originated in China, then spread to Korea, Vietnam, and Japan, countries in the East Asian cultural sphere.
Term Chinese (Trad./Simp.) Japanese Date (± 1 day)
Lichun 立春 Feb 4
Yushui 雨水 Feb 19
Jingzhe 驚蟄/惊蛰 啓蟄 Mar 6
Chunfen 春分 [tn]Vernal equinox[/tn] Mar 21
[[Qingming Festival|Qingming]] 清明 Apr 5
Guyu 穀雨/谷雨 Apr 20
Lixia 立夏 May 6
Xiaoman 小滿/小满 小満 May 21
Mangzhong 芒種/芒种 Jun 6
Xiazhi 夏至 [tn]Summer solstice[/tn] Jun 21
Xiaoshu 小暑 Jul 7
Dashu 大暑 Jul 23
Liqiu 立秋 Aug 8
Chushu 處暑/处暑 処暑 Aug 23
Bailu 白露 Sep 8
Qiufen 秋分 [tn]Autumnal equinox[/tn] Sep 23
Hanlu 寒露 Oct 8
Shuangjiang 霜降 Oct 23
Lidong 立冬 Nov 7
Xiaoxue 小雪 Nov 22
Daxue 大雪 Dec 7
Dongzhi 冬至 [tn]Winter solstice[/tn] Dec 22
Xiaohan 小寒 Jan 6
Dahan 大寒 Jan 20
h4. External links * "Wikipedia: Solar term":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Solar_term

title: horikawa_kunihiro
body:
A [i][[Touken Ranbu]][/i] character, the personification of the historical [[wakizashi]] [i]Horikawa Kunihiro[/i]. 
Character design by [[shiramine (srmn09)|Shiramine]], voiced by [[Enoki Jun'ya]]. 

Both he and [[Izumi-no-Kami Kanesada]] are personifications of swords that belonged to [[Hijikata Toshizou]]. He as a character is named after his swordsmith, as the sword he was based on went unnamed. After the Japanese surrendered in WWII, he was one of the 200,000 swords confiscated and dumped at sea. Only about 5600 were recovered, but his whereabouts were unknown and it is unlikely he's still around to this day. 

He has short [[black hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. He wears a blue [[double-breasted]] jacket with a red [[ribbon]], [[white pants]], and red [[stud earrings]]. In his Kiwame form, he wears a [[white scarf]], a black coat and black [[knee boots]]. For Internal Affairs, he wears a red [[track suit]].

Major player in [i][[Katsugeki/Touken Ranbu]][/i].

h4. Costumes
* !post #1934104: Base art
* !post #1934103: Track suit
* !post #2855694: [[Horikawa Kunihiro (kiwame)|Kiwame form]]

title: narukami_arashi
body: Character in [i][[Ensemble Stars!]][/i]. 2nd Year student of Yumenosaki high school and member of [[Knights (ensemble_stars!)|]]. Has a friendly demeanor. Is effeminate, and acts as the player character's pseudo-big "sister" at times. While the character identifies as female, the current policy is to tag Arashi as male unless physical evidence in the image proves otherwise.

title: tornado
body: A weather phenomenon characterized by a concentrated, rotating mass of air producing powerful, often damaging winds. In nature, tornadoes are normally spawned from severe thunderstorms or tropical cyclones under specific, complex meteorological conditions. While tornadoes can spawn virtually anywhere in the world, they are most common in America, with the majority occurring in two principal areas: Tornado Alley, famously stretching across the plains of the central US, and Dixie Alley, comprising portions of the American southeast. In fiction, tornadoes can be deliberately spawned by individuals or devices capable of controlling the wind or weather.

title: diao_chan
body:
Original language: 貂蟬 (Japanese: Chousen)

A fictional/semi-historical character from the novel "Romance of the Three Kingdoms" (三國演義). In the historical book "Records of the Three Kingdoms" (三國志), a maid of warlord Dong Zhuo sets him against the warrior Lu Bu, which bears reference to the semi-historical Diao Chan.

h4. External links

* [[Chousen (koihime musou)|]] from [[Koihime Musou]]

title: chinkyuu_(koihime_musou)
body:
A friend and self proclaimed partner and advisor of Ryofu, and considers herself Ryofu's protector, dishing out punishment to anyone doing anything she considers offensive to [[Ryofu (koihime musou)|]] (like she did to Kazuto when he bought Ryofu a bagful of nikuman in public, resulting in one of Ryofu's attention-getting eating escapades). She sports an officer's cap with a panda symbol on it.

Her real name is Nenene and the real-counter part of  Chen Gong who is really an advisor to Lü Bu(Ryofu)

title: lu_bu
body:
[b]Lü Bu[/b] (吕布), courtesy name [b]Fengxian[/b] (奉先), was a Chinese military general, politician, and warlord who lived during the late [[Han Dynasty|Eastern Han dynasty]] of [[Chinese empire|Imperial China]]. He is often depicted as wearing a golden [[headdress]] with pheasant [[feathers]] and riding his horse, [[Red Hare]] while wielding a [[Fangtian Ji]].

Originally a subordinate of a minor warlord [[Ding Yuan]], he betrayed and murdered Ding Yuan and defected to [[Dong Zhuo]] in the early 190s. In 192, he turned against Dong Zhuo and killed him after being instigated by [[Wang Yun]] and [[Shisun Rui]] (fictionalized using [[Diao Chan]]), but was later defeated and driven away by Dong Zhuo's followers.

From 192 to early 195, Lü Bu wandered around central and northern China, consecutively seeking shelter under warlords such as [[Yuan Shu]], [[Yuan Shao]], and [[Zhang Yang]]. In 194, he managed to take control of Yan Province from the warlord [[Cao Cao]], but Cao took back his territories within two years. In 195, Lü Bu turned against [[Liu Bei]], who had offered him refuge in Xu Province, and seized control of the province from his host. Although he had agreed to an alliance with Yuan Shu earlier, he severed ties with him after Yuan declared himself emperor and joined Cao and others in attacking the pretender. However, in 198, he sided with Yuan Shu again and came under attack by the combined forces of Cao and Liu, resulting in his defeat at the Battle of Xiapi in 199. He was captured and executed by strangulation on Cao's order.

Although Lü Bu is described in historical and fictional sources as a nearly unchallenged and peerless warrior, he was also notorious for his unstable behaviour and brutish/ruthless behavior. He switched allegiances erratically and freely betrayed his allies. He was always suspicious of others and could not control his subordinates. All these factors  eventually became the reason of his downfall.

h4. See also

* [[Lu Bu (Shin Sangoku Musou)|]] ([[Shin Sangoku Musou]])
* [[Ryofu (koihime musou)|]] ([[Koihime Musou]])
* [[Ryofu Housen ]] ([[Ikkitousen]])

title: senran_kagura_peach_beach_splash
body:
[b]SENRAN KAGURA: Peach Beach Splash[/b] ([b]閃乱カグラ PEACH BEACH SPLASH[/b]) is a multiplayer third person shooting game in the [[Senran Kagura]] series, published by [[Marvelous]] and developed by Honey∞Parade Games. It was released for the Playstation 4 on March 16, 2017, and for Windows on Steam, March 8, 2018.

Rather than the [[ninja]]-based action of its predecessors, the game features a [[water gun]] tournament where the winner is promised whatever they want as their reward. 

While the game was designed to unite all characters from the previous games into one central storyline, the cast includes several [[crossover|crossovers]] from other collaborations as well.

title: ryofu_(koihime_musou)
body:
Called a monster by others due to her ridiculous strength. In truth, she simply wishes to live peacefully with her pets, of which she has about fifty of. She loves Kazuto, but initially does not understand the feeling she experiences. When she eats, people who look at her cannot help but stare in awe. In the sequel, Shin Koihime Musō, she joins forces with the Shu kingdom and accompany by [[Chinkyu]].

Her real name is Ren and a real-counterpart of Lu Bu.

References: [[Lu Bu]], [[Ryofu Housen]]; [[Koihime Musou]]

title: dong_zhuo
body:
(Courtesy name: 仲穎/仲颖, Zhongying)

A Chinese warlord who lived in the late Eastern Han Dynasty. He was depicted as a selfish tyrant in Luo Guanzhong's [[Romance of the Three Kingdoms]].

He appeared in almost all of the Three Kingdoms-themed games as an antagonist in the early part. On danbooru, the Japanese reading of his name, [[Toutaku (koihime musou)|]], is currently used for a character in [[Koihime Musou]].

title: sun_ce
body:
[b]Sun Ce[/b] (孫策) (175 – 5 May 200), courtesy name [b]Bofu[/b], was a Chinese military general, politician, and warlord who lived during the late [[Han dynasty|Eastern Han dynasty]] of [[Chinese Empire|China]]. He was the eldest child of [[Sun Jian]], who was killed during the Battle of Xiangyang when Sun Ce was only 16. Sun Ce then broke away from his father's overlord, [[Yuan Shu]], and headed to the Jiangdong region in southern China to establish his own power base there. With the help of several people, such as [[Zhang Zhao]] and [[Zhou Yu]], Sun Ce managed to lay down the foundation of the state of [[Eastern Wu]] during the [[Romance of the Three Kingdoms|Three Kingdoms period]].

In 200, when the warlord [[Cao Cao]] was at war with his rival [[Yuan Shao]] in the Battle of Guandu, Sun Ce was rumoured to be planning an attack on Xuchang, Cao Cao's base. However, he was assassinated before he could carry out the plan. Sun Ce was posthumously honoured as "Prince Huan of Changsha" (長沙桓王) by his younger brother [[Sun Quan]] when the latter became the founding emperor of Eastern Wu. 

h4. See also

* [[Sun Ce (Shin Sangoku Musou)|]] ([[Shin Sangoku Musou]])
* [[Sonsaku (koihime musou)|]] ([[Koihime Musou]])
* [[Sonsaku Hakufu]] ([[Ikkitousen]])

title: zhao_yun
body:
[b]Zhao Yun[/b] (趙雲) (died 229), courtesy name [b]Zilong[/b] (子龍), was a military general who lived during the late [[Han Dynasty|Eastern Han dynasty]] and early [[Romance of the Three Kingdoms|Three Kingdoms period]] of [[Chinese Empire|China]]. Originally a subordinate of the northern warlord [[Gongsun Zan]], Zhao Yun later came to serve another warlord, [[Liu Bei]], and had since accompanied him on most of his military exploits, from the Battle of Changban (208) to the Hanzhong Campaign (217–219). He continued serving in the state of [[Shu Han]] – founded by Liu Bei in 221 – in the Three Kingdoms period and participated in the first of the Northern Expeditions until his death in 229. Along with [[Guan Yu]], [[Ma Chao]], [[Zhang Fei]], [[Huang Zhong]], he is considered a member of the [[Five Tiger Generals]].

h5. Adaptations in popular culture:
* [[Shin Sangoku Musou]] (Dynasty Warriors) 
* [[chouun (koihime musou)|Sei]] from [[Koihime Musou]]
* [[Chouun Shiryuu]] from [[Ikkitousen]]

title: chouhi_ekitoku
body:
Chouhi Ekitoku (張飛 益德): Zhang Fei - Yide
(Zhang Fei a strong fighter of Shu, one of Shu Five Tiger Generals)
Voiced by: Minori Chihara (Japanese), , Jessica Calvello (English)

Manga version
Ryuubi's best friend and an avid snack-lover. Although quite weak and only a C-rank, history states that she will one day become so powerful that legends will tell of her matching ten thousand men (just like Zhang Fei, himself), which makes her well-known around town. She has already performed such a feat, although on a much smaller scale, when Kyosho first assaulted Seito to search for Ryubi. Myosai almost killed her during their fight but she was luckily saved by Chou-un. She is currently out of action, recovering from the serious injuries suffered in the fight against Myosai. Ryubi is staying by her side.

Anime version
She is more bossy in the anime. She is frustrated that Ryubi is not the powerful toushi she is meant to be as Seito's leader. Despite that, she is still best friends with Ryubi and Kanu. She is strong enough to throw Kanu several stories into the air (probably representing Zhang Fei's roar at Changban when the Shu forces were retreating from Cao Cao). At the end of the series she is seen in a restaurant with Kouchu. The two could now be a couple.

Not confused with [[Chouhi (koihime musou)|Chouhi Ekitoku]] from [[Koihime Musou]] series and the [[Zhang Fei (romance Of The Three Kingdoms)|historical figure]].

title: liu_bei
body:
[b]Liu Bei[/b] (劉備), courtesy name [b]Xuande[/b] (玄德), was a Chinese warlord in the [[Han dynasty|late Eastern Han dynasty]] who later became the founding emperor of [[Shu Han]], one of the [[Romance of the Three Kingdoms|Three Kingdoms of China]]. He is commonly depicted as tall with big ears. Thanks to [i]Romance of the Three Kingdoms[/i], Liu Bei is widely regarded as the ideal benevolent and humane ruler who cared for his people and selected good advisers for his government, which attracts to his side many capable and heroic subordinates like [[Guan Yu]], [[Zhang Fei]], [[Zhao Yun]], [[Zhuge Liang]], and [[Pang Tong]].

Although he was a distant relative of the Han imperial family, he grew up poor and impoverished, selling shoes and straw mats. He studied under [[Lu Zhi]] with [[Gongsan Zan]]. He gathered a militia army to fight the [[Yellow Turbans]] with [[Guan Yu]] and [[Zhang Fei]], later participating in the coalition against [[Dong Zhuo]]. Following this, he joined his childhood friend Gongsun Zan and fought under him against [[Yuan Shao]], who then sent him to help [[Tao Qian]] against [[Cao Cao]]. Thanks to the support of the influential Mi and Chen families along with Tao Qian's last will, Liu Bei inherited the Xu Province. After his defeat against Cao Cao, [[Lu Bu|Lü Bu]] joined him, but betrayed him with Yuan Shu and seized Xu Province. Later Liu Bei joined Cao Cao and they defeated Lü Bu at the Battle of Xiapi. Although he was treated well by Cao Cao, Liu Bei received a secret edict from the emperor to kill Cao Cao and rebelled. After a brief alliance with Yuan Shao, Liu Bei was quickly defeated by Cao Cao and had to fflee. He was sent by Yuan Shao to create uprisings behind Cao Cao's main base, and later joined his kinsman [[Liu Biao]]. After Liu Biao's death, Liu Bei and his supporters joined [[Liu Qi]] in Xiakou where they allied with [[Sun Quan]]. Together they opposed Cao Cao at the Battle of Red Cliffs.

After Cao Cao's defeat, Liu Bei quickly took control of the majority of Jing Province and married Sun Quan's sister. Sun Quan then agreed to "lend" him Nan Commandery. Liu Bei later led his army to join another kinsman, [[Liu Zhang]], in his war against the warlord [[Zhang Lu]]. Based on the advice of his advisors, Liu Bei betrayed Liu Zhang and seized the Yi Province from him, before declaring himself "King of Hanzhong" and setting up his headquarters in Chengdu. However soon after [[Guan Yu]] was killed by Liu Bei's "ally" Sun Quan who took the rest of Jing province. Liu Bei was furious and led his army against his former ally but was defeated by [[Lu Xun]]. Ashamed by his failure, he never returned to Chengdu and settled in Baidicheng where he died one year later. He urged his heir, [[Liu Shan]] not to emulate him and rather be as virtuous as possible. Before he died Liu Bei appointed Zhuge Liang to advise his son on domestic matters with Li Yan to advise him on the military matters. 

h4. See also

* [[Liu Bei (Shin Sangoku Musou)|]] ([[Shin Sangoku Musou]])
* [[Ryuubi (koihime musou)|]] ([[Koihime Musou]])
* [[Ryuubi Gentoku]] ([[Ikkitousen]])

title: half-harpy
body:
A [[monster girl]] with significant bird-like features but lacks the definitive features of a [[harpy]], namely [[winged arms]]. Most characters having wings on the back—including [[low wings]]—in addition to other bird features, such as [[animal feet]], qualify for this tag instead of [[bird girl]]. Characters without wings at all may qualify if they're bird-like to the point of reasonably qualifying for [[monster girl]] (see post #6603555).

title: ultima_(tensura)
body:
Ultima takes the appearance of a cute and beautiful girl. She has  middle length [[purple hair]] tied into a [[side ponytail]], as well as purple fingernails. When she's off the clock she wears a variety of purple-colored dresses as casual wear and when she's serious she wears a black skirted military uniform with an armband on her left arm.

As a Demon, she has the characteristic horns and wings of their race, something she usually keeps hidden. She has six bat-like wings on her back that she can freely shapeshift into whatever she desires.

title: shion_(tensura)
body:
Voiced by: M.A.O (Japanese); Michelle Rojas (English)
Shion is a well endowed female ogre who is also a terrible cook. One of the six survivors of the ogre village. She becomes Rimuru's (self-appointed) secretary and bodyguard after evolving into a kijin and shares a rivalry with Shuna for Rimuru's attention. She is a great fighter, but often speaks out of turn, comically forcing Rimuru to take action to save face. She was given the simple title "Warrior" after the Orc Lord's defeat.

title: waha~_(meme)
body:
"Waha~" is a meme that was widely prevalent on 2chan and 4chan's /b/ and /jp/ boards from roughly 2002. It featured a [[chibi]] version of [[Yamato Suzuran]] dubbed [[Waha]] from the hentai game [[Suigetsu]] with her arms either [[outstretched arms|outstretched]] or in a [[\o/]] sort of pose, saying the titular "Waha~" phrase.

title: eversoul
body:
A Korean 3D idle gacha game developed by NINEARK and published by Kakao Games. 

"Initially titled [i]Soul Artifact[/i]":[https://mmoculture.com/2020/08/soul-artifact-kakao-signs-global-publishing-rights-for-new-mobile-rpg/] following its announcement in August 2020, 
"it was renamed to [i]Eversoul[/i]":[https://mmoculture.com/2021/07/eversoul-mobile-rpg-under-kakao-games-gets-a-new-name-and-art/] the following year. With an initial release window of December 2022, it would be quietly pushed back to January 5, 2023, releasing globally sans China, and subsequently released in Japan on May 29, 2024. 

h4. Synopsis
"Eversoul" tells the story of the Savior, a young man from modern-day Earth, being summoned to the world of Eden, an alternate Earth set in the distant future after the extinction of mankind, to become its hero and lead the immortal Souls in the fight against an unknown enemy wreaking havoc across their once-peaceful world.

h4. Known artist/s who worked on Eversoul / with NINEARK
* [[ankkoyom]] (NINEARK employee until November 2024 due to health issues)
* [[dramz]] (select characters)

h4. See also
[[List of Eversoul characters]]

h4. Official links
* "Global official site.":[https://eversoul.kakaogames.com/]
* "Japanese official site.":[https://jp-eversoul.kakaogames.com/]

title: suzutsuki_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Suzutsuki[/i]. Character design by [[Shisantian]].

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] and [[brown eyes]], possessing both normal human ears and [[animal ears]]. Her default outfit consists of a golden crow [[mask]], [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] white [[print kimono]] top with red ties and a [[fur collar]], black [[obi]], [[red skirt|red]] [[miniskirt]], black [[socks]]/[[tabi]], and [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her rigging consists of a hull piece around her waist containing her 610 mm quad [[torpedo tubes]], and a floating 10 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP gun mount]] on top of a [[shimenawa]].

h4. History
The real-life Suzutsuki participated in the ill-fated [[Operation Ten-Gou|Operation Ten-Go]], but she survived (despite extensive damage), along [[hatsushimo (azur lane)|Hatsushimo]], [[yukikaze (azur lane)|Yukikaze]], and Fuyutsuki. After the war she, along with Fuyutsuki, became part of a breakwater in Takamatsu in November 1945. Due to extensive repairs after typhoon damage in 1961 their hulls are completely buried.

Her true form is [[Majin Android 21]].

[spoiler]Her original template was [[Dr. Gero (dragon ball)|]]'s partner named [[Vomi (dragon ball)|]], while [[Android 16]]'s template was their son, [[Gevo (dragon ball)|]].[/spoiler]

title: sheffield_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the cruiser HMS [i]Sheffield[/i] (C24).

She has [[blonde_hair|blonde]] [[hair rings]] framing dull [[yellow eyes]] and pale skin. Like many other Royal Navy light cruisers, she is a [[maid]]. Her outfit is much more modest, revealing no cleavage like many other Royal maids, with a [[cross]] hanging from her neck. Her breasts are usually portrayed as smaller than her counterparts, though she bears no envy over it.

Unlike the other maids, Sheffield is much more serious about her duties and is very sharp-tongued and caustic towards the [[Commander_(azur_lane)|]]. She refuses to give into the lewd antics that the others (such as [[Sirius_(azur_lane)|]]) finds themselves involved in. She also specializes in espionage and special operations duties, emphasized in the anime, which also reveals her somewhat ironic status as a [[no_panties|different breed of commando]].

Character design by [[Maya G]], voiced by [[Kohara Konomi]].

h4. History

In real life, [i]Sheffield[/i] was the third of the [[Southampton (Azur Lane)|]]-class light cruisers, the first group of the Town-class. She earned the nickname "Shiny Sheff" on account of the fact that her interior fittings were done in stainless steel instead of brass, rare in the [[Royal Navy]].

She took part in the sinking of [[Bismarck (Azur Lane)|]], Arctic convoys, the battles of the Barents Sea and North Cape, the Salerno landings, and [[Victorious (Azur Lane)|]]' attempts to sink [[Tirpitz (Azur Lane)|]]. Consequently, she attained 12 battle honours.

Post-war, consideration was given to turn her to a museum ship as she largely remained unchanged from her war years but she had deteriorated in reserve so [[Belfast (Azur Lane)|]] was selected instead. She was scrapped in 1967.

title: seydlitz_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Imperial German battlecruiser SMS [i]Seydlitz[/i]. 
[tn]Not to be confused with the later Kriegsmarine heavy cruiser [i]Seydlitz[/i], who was converted to a light carrier as [[Weser (Azur Lane)|]].[/tn] 
Character design by [[Hou (ppo)|]], voiced by [[Tsuda Minami]].

h4. Appearance

In-game, she is portrayed with [[pink hair]] and [[blue eyes]], while wearing a [[peaked cap]], [[double-breasted]] two-tone [[military uniform]] with [[epaulettes]], and a [[black cape]]. She is also shown wielding a [[sword]]. Her rig is themed with the rest of Ironblood, with her five 28 cm twin gun mounts placed on animalistic rigs: one each to her side, one to her left, two her right.

h4. History
In real life, [i]Seydlitz[/i] was a one-off battlecruiser born out of Imperial Navy Department requests for more battlecruisers to match the [[Royal Navy]], with assistance from Admiral Alfred von [[Tirpitz (Azur Lane)|]]. In particular, [i]Seydlitz[/i] featured better armor and propulsion over her preceding battlecruisers.

She was commissioned in 1913, with her first crew that of [[Yorck (Azur Lane)|]]'s, having just been transferred to reserve.

She participated in many fleet actions throughout World War I, especially the battles of Dogger Bank and Jutland, where she survived severe damage that would have otherwise sunk her (which explains one of her skills that grants her temporary immunity from being sunk in a sortie). Later, she would have been part of the [[Operation Ten-Gou|Ten Go]]-style "suicidal sortie":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naval_order_of_24_October_1918] of the German Navy's High Seas Fleet in late October 1918, but mutinies broke out that forced the cancellation of the sortie. A month later, the ship was interned in Scapa Flow with the rest of the High Seas Fleet and scuttled a year later to prevent them from being divvied up by the Allies.

title: robin_(dc)
body:
The traditional sidekick of [[Batman]]. A legacy title, passed down to several people in the [[DC Comics]] continuity:
* [[Dick Grayson]] - the first Robin, becomes [[Nightwing]] after retiring his previous role
* [[Jason Todd]] - the second Robin, killed on duty; becomes [[red hood (dc)|Red Hood]]
* [[Tim Drake]] - the third Robin, becomes [[Red Robin]] after retiring as Robin
* [[Carrie Kelley]] - Female Robin in an alternate future. Was Not Robin in the normal DC timeline.  Becomes a [[catgirl (dc)|Catgirl]] afterwards
* [[Stephanie Brown]] - The fourth Robin and first female Robin in the normal DC timeline, had the identity for a time, becomes the third [[Batgirl]] afterwards who was trained by [[Barbara Gordon]], the 1st Batgirl
* [[Damian Wayne]] - the fifth Robin, currently holds the title

title: shadowverse
body:
A digital card battle game by [[Cygames]]. The game is divided into a story campaign spread across multiple worlds sci-fi or fantasy alike and a PVP mode featuring various tournaments in addition to "tie-in" events (collaboration events) between different franchises.

Shadowverse was released in June 2016. An [[Shadowverse_(anime)|anime adaptation]] by Zexcs aired from April 2020 to March 2021. A second anime series titled [[shadowverse_flame|Shadowverse Flame]] is currently being aired following the events of the first one after a three-year time skip.

h4. Gameplay

To begin, one must choose one of eight classes to play with (whichever one you choose can be changed later) each with a different playstyle and mechanics. Each class has access to a personal selection of cards in addition to a general pool (which is counted as a ninth class not playable on its own). 

Each player can mulligan their starting hand to find better cards in case of a bad draw. The player who goes first gets 2 evolution points, and the player who goes second gets 3 evolution points. 

At the start of their turn, each player draws one card from their deck and places it in their hand. The player who goes second draws two cards on the first turn. Cards in the deck can't be seen during battle.

h4. See also

* [[shadowverse_(animated_series)|Shadowverse Anime]]
* [[Shadowverse Evolve |]]
* [[Shadowverse: Worlds Beyond|]]
* [[List of Shadowverse characters]]

h4. External links

* "Official Youtube channel":[https://www.youtube.com/@shadowversegame]
* "Shadowverse Wiki":[https://shadowverse.fandom.com/wiki/Shadowverse_Wiki]
* "Wikipedia: Shadowverse":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shadowverse]

title: the_orville
body:
The Orville is an American science fiction comedy drama television series created by Seth MacFarlane, who also stars as the protagonist Ed Mercer, an officer in the Planetary Union's line of exploratory space vessels in the 25th century. It was inspired primarily by the [[star trek: the original series|original Star Trek]] and [[star trek: the next generation|Next Generation]] eras, both of which it heavily parodies and pays homage to. The series also uses inspiration from the [[Star Wars]] franchise. It follows the crew of the starship USS Orville on their episodic adventures, as well as a serialized story which develops over the length of the series.

body:
[b]Pero[/b] is a character in [[Dragon Quest Builders 2]] that the player encounters in Khrumbul-Dun. She aspires to be a dancer like her mother and tends to garner the affections of the majority of the males in the town to the dismay of her father, [[Aman_(dqb2)|Aman]]. She was renamed to [b]Babs[/b] in the English release of the game.

In terms of appearance, Pero's appearance changes multiple times throughout her storyline. Most often, she sports either [[brown hair]] or [[orange hair]]. She also wears either a [[red dress]] or three different variations of a [[nontraditional playboy bunny]] costume.

title: durandal_(honkai_impact)
body:
Playable valkyrie in [[Honkai Impact 3rd]]. Voiced by [[Noto Mamiko]] in Japanese. An orphan who has lost her memories of her origins, she is now the strongest S-rank valkyrie of Schicksal.

As revealed in Chapter 28, [spoiler]she is actually the original [[Kiana Kaslana]], daughter of [[Cecilia Schariac]] and [[Siegfried Kaslana]]. She was thought to have died during a failed attempt by Siegfried and K-423 to rescue her from captivity under [[Otto Apocalypse]], but she survived to be recaptured and have her memory altered to forget her true identity. title: witch's_heart
body:
A story-focused game with horror and light action elements created in RPG Maker 2000 by [[bluestar iz|IZ (BLUE STAR Entertainment)]].  

It follows [[Claire Elford]], a cheerful young woman that gets trapped in a cursed mansion along with four other men - the traveler/witch researcher [[Ashe Bradley]], the mysterious individual [[Wilardo Adler]], a gentle young man named [[Noel Levine]], and the lord of the mansion [[Sirius Gibson]]. Throughout the course of five days, the group has to find a way to escape the mansion, all while uncovering the secrets within it, and learning the truth about the legendary wish-granting treasure: the [i]Witch's Heart[/i]. 

The game is split into four scenarios, each based on the different main characters trapped with Claire, and they’re all mandatory in order to complete the base game. There are mild combat elements through the monsters and bosses the player encounters, as well as a wide variety of mini games and interactions with other characters. 

The game has a sequel named the "Bonus Stage", along with four endings of the routes in the form of separate games called "Conclusion" - though at the time only Sirius’ Conclusion is released.

h4. Characters
h5. Humans
* [[Claire Elford]]
* [[Sirius Gibson]]
* [[Noel Levine]]
* [[Wilardo Adler]]
* [[Ashe Bradley]]
* [[Lilia Bradley]]

h5. Demons
* [[Zizel (witch's heart)|]]
* [[Lime (witch's heart)|]]
* [[Charlotte (witch's heart)|]]
* [[Rouge (witch's heart)|]]

title: navel_hair
body:
Hair grown around the [[navel]] area and/or leading down to the [[pubic hair|pubic area]], often appearing as an inverted V-shaped patch or narrow line. Commonly found on adult males and rarely on females. Slang terms for the line-shaped variant include "happy trail" and "treasure trail".

h4.See also

title: variations
body:
Pictures of the same character repeatedly in the same image that have been either copied and pasted or redrawn. Only a single outfit should be present, and most of its appearance should be preserved between variations, with only minor alterations to hair/clothing style, color, and accessories. If the difference is more significant, use [[multiple views]] instead.

This should be differentiated from sequential actions, such as a frame-by-frame rendition of a dance, or the stages of creating an illustration (sketch, inking, color, etc.). The latter should be [[how to]]. This also does not include [[comparison]]s between different characters or different characters [[matching outfits|wearing the same outfit]].

Not to be confused with [[variant set]], which refers to a series of images depicting the same scene with some differences.

h4. Examples
* !post #7537363
* !post #7241999
* !post #5404159

title: amamiya_ren
body:
The [[Persona 5]] player character. Voiced by [[Fukuyama Jun]] (JP) / [[Xander Mobus]] (EN).

The leader of the Phantom Thieves. A 16-year-old young man and second-year high school student who transfers to Shujin Academy. He seems quiet and well-mannered at first glance, but gives a completely different impression once he has donned his "phantom thief" guise. He finds residence at Cafe LeBlanc, run by [[Sakura Soujirou]], after getting expelled from his school for being accused of assaulting a man who was molesting a woman.

The name used for his tag is lifted from his anime appearance, [[Persona 5: Dancing Star Night]], as well as being the default name for the 2022 re-release of [[Persona 5 The Royal]]. Previously, the manga adaption gave him the name "Kurusu Akira". His codename among the Phantom Thieves, "Joker", is used as his official name in some other sources, such as his appearance in [[super_smash_bros.|Super Smash Bros. Ultimate]].

title: el_chapulin_colorado
body:
[quote][i]"THEY DIDN'T COUNT ON MY CUNNING....!!!".[/i] - The Chapulin Colorado's catchphrase[/quote]

[b]El Chapulín Colorado[/b] ([i]"The Red Grasshopper"[/i]) is a [[mexico|Mexican]] superhero that stars in [[el chapulin colorado (series)|the comedy show of the same name]]. He wears a red and yellow [[superhero costume|super-powered uniform]] with insect antennae called "Antenitas de Vinil" ("Little Vinyl Antennae") that he uses to detect villains. 

Chapulin is armed with a [[sledgehammer]] called the "[[Chipote Chillon]]" ("Crying Bump"). He also uses special secret pills called "Pastillas de Chiquitolina" ("Tinylenol Tablets") to reduce in size to that of a [[grasshopper]].

The character is played by the same actor who plays [[El Chavo]], "Roberto Gómez Bolaños, a.k.a. Chespirito":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chespirito].

The "BumbleBee Man":https://simpsons.fandom.com/wiki/Pedro_Chespirito from [[The Simpsons]] was inspired by Chapulín. He also appears in the [[One-Punch Man]] anime and manga series as a very similar character called [[Smile Man]].

h4. See also

* [[El Chavo]]

title: vaulted_ceiling
body:
A [i]vaulted ceiling[/i] is an architectural term for arched formations used to hold up a ceiling. Historically, they were made of stone and used to hold ceilings up in large stone structures (such as churches and castles). Will likely also be a [[high ceiling]], but vaulted ceilings were also used in crypts and lower parts of castles with regular ceiling heights so as to support the upper structure.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article on vaults in architecture":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vault_(architecture)]

title: high_ceiling
body: An [[indoors|indoor]] space with a particularly [i]high ceiling[/i], such as might be found in a [[cathedral]] or [[ballroom]]. May also be a [[vaulted ceiling]]. Do not use if the ceiling is not visible unless the location is clearly indoors with tall enough visible walls to imply a high ceiling out of frame.

title: chargeman_ken!
body:
A notoriously bad anime series created by "Knack":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knack_Productions] and broadcasted in 1974. It was made with such poor direction, and on such a ridiculously low budget, that they regularly tried (and failed) to squeeze 20 minutes of plot into the 4 or 5 minutes they could already barely afford to animate for each episode; there were several other obvious production problems as well, such as missing sound effects and a very limited range of background music.

The voice cast for this series is still not publicly known, as no production credits were provided in the actual show.

To this day, several frames of the anime have become popular for artists to redraw:
* !asset #23421763: Shocked Ken
* !asset #23421764: Hoshi-kun
* !asset #23421766: The KMIYs

title: rezel_commander_type
body:
A fictional variable geometry manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]RGZ-95C ReZEL Commander Type[/b]

A higher spec variant of the [[ReZEL]] [[mobile_suit|MS]]  intended for superior pilots and commanders. The base unit's various limiters are scaled back for maximum performance, and its controls are much more complex allowing for maximum precision in combat. It can be differentiated from the basic ReZEL by its visor and shoulder sensors (they are green in the Commander Type and red in the common ones). 

The mighty General Revil battleship exclusively fielded this variant, which was painted in the GR tan and orange with yellow sensors, and had further refits enabling those special units to equip both the Defenser-a assault pack and Defenser-b long range fire support pack.

title: z_ii_gundam
body:
A fictional variable geometry manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]MSZ-008 ZII[/b]

A further development of the Zeta Project, aimed at simplifying the design of the [[zeta Gundam (mobile suit)|Zeta Gundam]] [[mobile suit]] and making it both easier to pilot and cheaper to produce. Using the know-how from the [[Methuss]], the resulting machine - named ZII, read as "Ze-Two" - boasted considerable firepower thanks to the Mega Beam Cannon, which rivaled the Zeta Gundam's High Mega Launcher's output, and achieved its goals of reduced costs and ease of use. 

However, it sacrificed its predecessor's atmospheric entry and flight capabilities, and was ultimately used sparsely until it was retired, while its combat data was taken into account during the development of the more successful [[ReZEL]].

title: ni-ni_the_mirror_mikanko
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 3
[b]Attribute:[/b] Water
[b]Type:[/b] Spellcaster / Effect
[i]
If this card is not equipped with an Equip Card, you take no damage from battles involving this card. If this card is equipped with an Equip Card, it cannot be destroyed by battle and your opponent takes any battle damage you would have taken from battles involving this card. During your opponent's turn, while this card is equipped with an Equip Card (Quick Effect): You can target 1 face-up monster your opponent controls; take control of it until the End Phase. You can only use this effect of "Ni-Ni the Mirror Mikanko" once per turn.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 0
[b]DEF:[/b] 0

A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]], part of the "Mikanko" archetype. Ni-Ni the Mirror Mikanko wears a blue [[japanese clothes]], she can makes multiple [[mirror]]s from water, which are based on the Yata-no-Kagami. She is the daughter of the Mikagami house.

title: half-skirt
body:
A type of [[skirt]] that leaves one leg exposed by ending around the crotch area on the front and around the side or the back of the thigh area on the other, often [[overskirt|worn over]] a pair of [[shorts]] or a shorter skirt, although many times they come as a single piece.

Not to be confused with a [[showgirl skirt]], in which the entire front area is missing, or with a [[high-low skirt]] in which the front half is shorter than the back.

If it's clear that it's being worn over a separate skirt, shorts or pants, also tag [[overskirt]].

h4. Examples
* !post #4200833
* !post #2433900
* !post #4640616
* !post #2825221
* !post #5661216
* !post #5792325

h5. NOT a half-skirt
* !post #5805627: [[overskirt]]
* !post #2017994: [[showgirl skirt]]
* !post #5627182: shorts + [[pelvic curtain]]
* !post #6798243: [[asymmetrical skirt]] + overskirt + shorts

* [[High-low skirt]]

title: dress_lift
body:
Lifting up a person's dress, usually with the intent to show off their underwear or bare crotch/butt. Usually this is done either by the wearer of the dress or someone nearby. It could also be caused by an inanimate object, such as a hook or other object that might catch the dress and lift it up. It can be done voluntarily or involuntarily (by another person/object).

If the dress is merely being held - not in a particularly revealing fashion - use the tag [[skirt hold]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[bra lift]]
* [[dress pull]]
* [[dress tug]]
* [[skirt lift]]
* [[shirt lift]]

title: skirt_hold
body:
Lifting a [[skirt]] or [[dress]] in a non-revealing fashion (as opposed to [[skirt lift]]), typically so it doesn't touch the floor.

If the character is pulling the skirt down so as to hide their underwear and/or legs, use [[skirt tug]].

For holding objects in a skirt, see [[skirt basket]].  For holding a skirt that's not being worn, see [[holding unworn skirt]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7230292

title: kantai_collection_(anime)
body:
The three anime projects based off the browser game [[Kantai Collection]].

The original anime aired in January 2015 and is loosely based off the first six months of the Pacific War leading up to the [[Battle of Midway]]. A follow-up film, [i]KanColle: The Movie[/i], was released in November 2016, and is based off the Guadalcanal Campaign.

The third anime project, [i]Itsuka Ano Umi de[/i] (いつかあの海で), was released in November 2022 and is based off the battle of Leyte Gulf up to [[Operation Ten-gou]].

The original 2015 series and 2016 film featured [[Fubuki (kancolle)|]] as the main character, with the storyline based on her point of view. The 2022 series, however, features [[Shigure (Kancolle)|]] as the main character. 

h4. Official key visual

* !post #1766790: 2015
* !post #5438643: 2016
* !post #5225622: Itsuka Ano Umi De

title: shiratsuyu_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
Upon reaching kai ni, [[shiratsuyu (kancolle)|Shiratsuyu's]] hair is now longer and shifts towards a faint blue color, while sporting the distinctive [[hair flaps]] seen among her remodeled sisters. She also wears a [[whistle]] [[whistle around neck|around her neck]]. In addition, her breasts become more noticeably prominent. 

Her outfit now includes [[fingerless gloves]] and a longer right sleeve, while her legwear changes to [[thighhighs]], giving her [[zettai ryouiki]].

As for her [[rigging]], she replaces her 12.7 cm single gun mount Type A with a second twin mount Type C in an attachment on her left that also includes her historic Type 22 [[radar]]. On her mast, the flag signals "5" and "Z" are flown from the halyard.

h4. Appearance

title: stalker_(1979)
body:
Stalker (Russian: Сталкер) is a 1979 Soviet science fiction film directed by Andrei Tarkovsky. The film tells the story of an expedition led by a figure known as the "Stalker", who guides his two clients—a melancholic writer and a professor—through a hazardous wasteland to a mysterious restricted site known simply as the "Zone".

Upon release, the film garnered praise in the Soviet and Warsaw Pact press, but only mixed reviews in the West. However, in subsequent years it has been recognized as one of the greatest films of all time.

The film is the direct inspiration of the [[stalker_(game)|video game series]] of the same name.

h4. External Links
* https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stalker_(1979_film)

title: isaku
body:
An eroge developed by elf, and the first game in the "[[Saku (series)|-saku]]" series. It was originally released for the [[PC-98]] in 1995, and later remade for [[Microsoft Windows]] platforms in 1999. All artwork for both versions were illustrated by [[Yokota Mamoru]].

Unlike its successors, Isaku is a horror-themed escape game that follows [[Kogure Kenta]] as he attempts to escape an abandoned school building with serveral other students trapped with him. All the while, he must outwit the titular antagonist [[Itou Isaku]], who will attempt to rape and torture the other students should they be caught.

title: suicideboys
body:
An American rapper duo from New Orleans, Lousiana, consisting of rappers [[Scrim]] (born Scott Arceneaux Jr. on April 11, 1989) and [[Ruby da Cherry]] (born Aristos Petrou on April 22, 1990). They are founders of the independent record label [G59 Records](https://g59records.com) that houses fellow rappers like Ramirez, Shakewell and "Germ":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germ_(rapper)].

h4. See also:
* [[Lil Peep]], a fellow American rapper with connections to the Suicideboys through collaborations

title: lil_peep
body:
Gustav Elijah Ahr (born November 1, 1996, died November 21, 2017), known by the stage name Lil Peep (formerly Trap Goose from 2013-2014), was a rapper/singer credited with helping develop the genre of [emo rap.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emo_rap) Before his death, his popularity in the underground rap scene and being in a group like [GothBoiClique](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GothBoiClique) helped him rise up in the industry. His 1st and only studio album to be released before his death [Come Over When You're Sober, Part 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Come_Over_When_You%27re_Sober,_Pt._1) managed to chart the Billboard 200, peaking at #38.

h4. See also:
* [[Suicideboys]], an American rapper duo with connections to Lil Peep through collaborations

title: yu-bird
body:
Yu-bird is a female side character / [[creature]] from [[Sen to Chihiro no Kamikakushi]].  It is in it's true form a creature with a raven-like body and a head resembling that of its master [[Yubaba]]'s. It initially serves as Yubaba's servant / spy. Throughout much of the movie it is transformed into another form referred to as "Haedori" / "Fly-Bird", with the head of a tiny bird, and the body of a fly.

It develops an affinity for and is often paired alongside [[Bou (Sen to Chihiro no Kamikakushi)|]] in his transformed mouse form and carries him around.

title: bou_(sen_to_chihiro_no_kamikakushi)
body: "Bou" is a male side character from [[Sen to Chihiro no Kamikakushi]].  He is [[Yubaba]]'s [[mother and son|son]], and in his true form appears as a giant [[baby]] wearing a red [[dudou]] with his name on it.  For much of the film he is transformed into a plump [[mouse]] who largely moves around by means of being carried by the transformed fly-like version of [[Yu-Bird]], for whom he develops an affinity towards and is usually paired with.

title: ferrari_laferrari
body:
Also known as the F150, this is a [[Ferrari]] hybrid hypercar. At the time of its introduction in 2013, it was the strongest production car manufactured by the company, and it was the successor to the [[Ferrari Enzo Ferrari]] as the brand's mid-engined V12 halo car.

It is widely believed to be the car associated with [[Taihou (Azur Lane)|Taihou]]'s [[Taihou (Enraptured Companion)  (Azur Lane)|Enraptured Companion]] [[race queen]] skin in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i].

title: bai_clothes
body: The Bai - or Pai - are an East Asian ethnic group native to the Bijie area of Guizhou Province, and Sangzhi area of Hunan Province. They constitute one of the 56 ethnic groups officially recognized by China. The Bai people hold the colour white in high esteem, (hence the use of 'Bai', Chinese for 'white', in their name). "The Bai people, as their name would suggest, favor white clothes and decorations. Women generally wear white dresses, sleeveless jackets of red, blue, or black, embroidered belts, loose trousers, embroidered shoes of white cloth, and jewelry made of gold or silver. Women in Dali traditionally wear a white coat trimmed with a black or purple collar, loose blue trousers, embroidered shoes, silver bracelets, and earrings. Unmarried women wear a single pigtail on the top of their head, while married women roll their hair. The men wear white jackets, black-collared coats, and dark loose shorts. Their headwear and costume reflect the Bai symbols: the snow, the moon, the flower, and the wind. Many Bai women style their hair in a long braid wrapped in a headcloth. This style is called 'the phoenix bows its head'." (Wikipedia) h4. See also * [[Chinese Clothes]] h4. External links * "Wikipedia: Bai People":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Hanfu

title: pineapple_on_pizza
body:
Any kind of [[pizza]] topped with [[pineapple]], whether as chunks traditionally, or humorously slices or even whole. Humorously associated with the Food Atrocities pool, and the [[How to Torture an Italian (meme)|]] [[meme]] due to how some people consider this combination disgusting.

The most common sort of pizza with pineapple on it is [[Hawaiian pizza]], which pairs the pineapple with ham (or Canadian bacon/salami/etc), to the point where to many people 'Hawaiian pizza' is synonymous with 'Pineapple pizza'.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: pizza_time_(meme)
body:
Pizza Time is a quote from [[Spider-Man 2]], the 2004 [[Spider-Man]] film directed by Sam Raimi and starring [[Tobey Maguire]] as [[Peter Parker]]. The quote has been used in various remix memes and shitposts as well as a reaction image.

H4. Origin
At the beginning of Spider-Man 2, Peter Parker is working as a [[pizza]] delivery boy while juggling his duties as Spider-Man. When delivering pizza to a customer, he says the phrase, "Pizza time!"

title: mazepynka
body: A mazepynka is a cap worn by Ukrainian soldiers. Created by Levko Lepkyi for the Ukrainian Sich Riflemen in 1916, it was named for 17th-century Ukrainian leader Ivan Mazepa, and is still used by the Ukrainian Armed Forces today.

title: petliurivka
body: Petliurivka is a soft British-style cap introduced to the Ukrainian army by Hetman Pavlo Skoropadskyi in 1918. It was used by the Army of the Ukrainian People's Republic (1918-1920) and replaced the [[mazepynka]] of the Ukrainian Galician Army (1918-1920) after the merger of the two armies.

body:
A term first popularized by Id's [[Quake 1]] but also used in their grand daddy of games, [[Doom i]], albeit not as popular as the former.

It involves using an explosion, usually caused by a rocket from a [[rocket launcher]] but other's also include sticky jumping from [[Demoman (tf2)|]] from [[Team Fortress 2]], and use it to propel the user with great momentum either towards the sky or to a point quickly.

The most prominent user of rocket jumping is [[Soldier (tf2)|]] which in game encourages the player to learn rocket jumping to get to points where are regarded as impossible to be on or get to it quickly.

The final boss of the first [[Doom i]] game, and recurring boss in [[Doom II]]. An enormous brain with a face and arms, supported by spider-like robotic legs, with a [[gatling gun]] attached to it's chassis.

Returns in [[Doom (2016)]] as the final boss there as well, instead with a [[plasma rifle]] attached to its chassis.

title: hatsune_miku_(vocaloid4)
body:
The [[VOCALOID]]4 voicebank for [[Hatsune Miku]] (dubbed V4X). Continuing from her [[hatsune miku (vocaloid3)|VOCALOID3 design]], the design for this version is once again illustrated by [[iXima]]. This would be her last VOCALOID voicebank for 8 years, switching to [[Hatsune Miku (NT)|Pripro Studio]] in the meantime, before returning with her VOCALOID6 iteration.

Following a similar design to V3, she now has tighter [[detached sleeves]] and [[thigh boots]] that are [[see-through footwear|see-through]]. The [[skirt]] is still double layered, she has a smaller [[headset]], a white [[sleeveless shirt]] with translucent aqua strips along the shoulders, and pink [[hair ornament]]s (now single pink squares).

h4. Official art

* !post #2534170
* !post #2534159
* !post #2534175
* !post #5740267

h4. See also

A nameless character in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]]. She is the mother of [[Sena Mikoto]].

She has no canon design.

title: satomi_touka's_father
body:
An unnamed character in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]]. He is the father of [[Satomi Touka]], the brother of [[Satomi Tasuke]] and the uncle of [[Satomi Nayuta]]. He also works as a doctor.

He's a [[mature male|middle-aged man]] with [[brown eyes]] and [[very short hair|very short]] [[brown hair]]. He wears a [[white coat|white]] [[coat]] with [[lapels]], [[long sleeves]], [[buttons]] and a [[breast pocket]]; a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], a [[red necktie|red]] [[necktie]] and [[grey pants|grey]] [[pants]]. He is also often seen with a [[stethoscope]] and a [[lanyard]].

title: brock_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Brock[/b], known as [b]Takeshi[/b] (タケシ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon rgby|Red and Green]][/i].

Known as the rock-solid Pokémon Trainer, he is a reliable Gym Leader who watches over and supports younger Trainers [tn](official bio)[/tn]. His signature Pokémon is [[Onix]].

In his [[pokemon hgss|HGSS]] outfit, he has mostly [[closed eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[spiked hair|spiked]] [[brown hair]]. He wears a [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[orange shirt]] with a [[v-neck]], a [[loose belt|loose]] [[black belt]], [[baggy pants|baggy]] [[green pants]], and [[orange footwear|orange]] [[shoes]].

title: maxx_c
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 3
[b]Attribute:[/b] Earth
[b]Type:[/b] Insect/Effect
During either player's turn: You can send this card from your hand to the Graveyard; this turn, each time your opponent Special Summons a monster(s), immediately draw 1 card. You can only use 1 "Maxx C" per turn.

[b]ATK:[/b] 500
[b]DEF:[/b] 200

A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[Duel Monster]] card. Known within the community as one of the most powerful "hand trap" cards ever released due to its ability to allow its user to capitalize on their opponent's special summon combo (that has become prevalent in the 2010's onward) and easily find a card(s) to counter them. This often results into the opponent having to stop their summoning combo to prevent the Maxx C's user from gaining more card advantage. Alternately, the opponent will try the "Maxx C challenge", meaning they will special summon as many monsters as possible in an attempt to deck out the opponent. The card was banned from TCG in 2018, but still sees widespread use in the OCG and [[Yu-Gi-Oh! Master Duel]].

Its Japanese name is "Proliferating G", with "G" standing for "gokiburi", a Japanese word for [[cockroach]]. The monster itself is depicted as many pairs of shiny eyes, representing cockroaches lurking in the shadows.

title: agano_(setsubun)_(kancolle)
body:

She is portrayed with [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]] and light [[green eyes]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: a white [[serafuku]] that exposes her [[midriff]] with a red [[pleated skirt]], [[blue necktie]], [[white gloves]], [[belt]], [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]], and has [[uneven legwear]] where the left leg has a [[single thighhigh]] stocking on a [[garter_straps|garter strap]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge, [[smokestack]], and mast worn in a backpack-like arrangement, her three 15.2 cm twin gun mounts controlled by [[joystick]]s, an 8 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]] mount on her right ankle, and a [[flight deck]] on her left leg.

title: shitty_admiral_(phrase)
body:
A [[meme]] in [[Kantai Collection]]. When [[Akebono (kancolle)|]] is your secretary ship, she will occasionally call you クソ提督 (Kuso Teitoku, lit. "Shitty Admiral"). This "hostility" towards the admiral/player character stems from how she was treated in World War II. 

This tag is only for the phrase itself. Do not use this tag when the [[admiral (kancolle)|Admiral]] is merely acting like a jerk. Use pool #8302 ("Shitty Admiral") instead.

Like [[Kasumi (kancolle)|]], her sharp tongue is based upon her historical namesake being the victim of unfair treatment by the real-life admiral in charge. The captain of Akebono was unjustly scapegoated by the admiral for letting Shoukaku become damaged during the Battle of Coral Sea, even though there was little a destroyer could do about multiple waves of aircraft. She was reassigned to the rear after that, and never again had a prestigious post. Furthermore, on her next escort mission [i][[Albacore (Azur Lane)|USS Albacore]][/i] sank her sister-ship Sazanami. When Akebono went searching for USS Albacore, it delayed her so much the transports she was escorting were also destroyed.

In the battle of Leyte Gulf/Surigao Strait, she was assigned to protect Mogami after a collision with Nachi caused by the admiral's hasty retreat. Mogami was then sunk by air attacks which Akebono was powerless to stop. Akebono was afterward tasked with protecting Nachi from further air attacks in Manila, which resulted in Nachi being destroyed by aircraft and Akebono being severely damaged. Akebono was towed to dock by Ushio, but further air raids destroyed Akebono in Manila Bay alongside [[Akishimo (Kancolle)|]]. Ultimately, Ushio was not only a survivor of the war, but her better war record got her improved anti-air defenses to protect against air raids, while Akebono languished.

title: ushio_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The second remodel/kai ni of [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s [[Ushio (Kancolle)|]]. 

Upon reaching kai ni, she gains a green-and-brown [[camouflage]] painted on her [[rigging]], boots and armaments, reflective of her final camo pattern when she was stationed in Yokosuka post-Leyte Gulf. A long [[white ribbon]] is worn like a [[headband]], tied in a bow that flutters behind her ([i]the most obvious difference if she's not depicted wearing her battle rig[/i]), and she has depth charges worn looped on her skirt belt. When taking medium or heavy damage, her CG also now reveals she wears [[rabbit panties]]. Otherwise she retains her base form [[serafuku]] and [[blue skirt]] like [[Akebono Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Akebono's]].

Her pink bunny-gun is replaced with a true-to-life 12.7 cm twin gun mount Type 89 (which she never received in real life, she retained her Type C mounts to the end) on her right [[wristband]], and a platform for two 25 mm triple AA mounts on her left wristband. She also gains [[depth charge|depth charges]] attached to her skirt.

title: yahagi_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The second remodel of [[Yahagi (Kancolle)|]] from [[Kantai Collection]].

[[yahagi (kancolle)|Yahagi]] is the second of her class, after [[noshiro (kancolle)|Noshiro]], to obtain her second remodel on March 31, 2021, although her getting a second remodel had already been known before Noshiro's through a series of trailers for the second Kantai Collection anime, starting with the one shown at the Kancolle Jazz Concert Festival in 2019.

Yahagi has two second remodels, Kai Ni and Kai Ni Tei (2B). Yahagi's Kai Ni form is almost identical to Noshiro's: She switches to a new [[serafuku]] consisting of a black [[pleated skirt]], a black dress shirt worn under a long-sleeved sailor shirt with a [[black sailor collar]], and a black stylized [[necktie]], as well as exchanging her [[red scrunchie]] for a [[white scrunchie|white one]]. She also wears a pair of black [[thighhighs]]. She differs from Noshiro by having her shirt partially open from the bottom and draped over her skirt rather than tucked in, her sleeves stopping mid-forearm rather than at the wrist, allowing her to keep her gloves, and only one set of garter straps is holding her left thighhigh as opposed to both. 

In her Kai Ni Tei form, she switches to a white dress shirt worn under a mostly open long-sleeved black sailor shirt (black sailor collar being kept) and the necktie is now orange. She also eliminates her right thighhigh, similar to her base form. This Kai Ni Tei form is what was apparently shown in the said trailers.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4441710: Tei

title: zero_wing
body:
[b]Zero Wing[/b] is a 1989 side-scrolling shooter arcade [[video game]] developed by [[Toaplan]] and originally published in Japan by [[Namco]] and in North America by Williams Electronics. 

Controlling the ZIG space fighter craft, players assume the role of protagonist Trent in a last-ditch effort to overthrow the [[alien]] [[cyborg]] [[CATS (zero wing)|]]. It was the eighth shoot 'em up game from Toaplan, and their fourteenth video game overall.

Headed by development chief Ōta Toshiaki, Zero Wing was created by most of the same team that previously worked on several projects at Toaplan, initially starting as a project not intended for commercial release but to train new recruits before being ultimately released to the market. Although first launched in arcades, the game was later ported to other platforms, each one featuring several changes or additions compared with the original version.

Zero Wing enjoyed a degree of success in arcades and its home conversions were met with mostly positive reception from critics. The European [[Sega Mega Drive]] version later gained renewed popularity due to the "[[All your base are belong to us (meme)|]]" internet meme, which plays off the badly translated introductory cutscene in [[engrish text|Engrish]]. 

The rights to the title are owned by Tatsujin, a Japanese company formed by Masahiro Yuge. The Mega Drive version was later released in North America by independent publisher [[Retro-Bit]] in 2020.

title: all_your_base_are_belong_to_us_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] resulting from a [[engrish text|shoddy English translation]] of the [[video game]] [[Zero Wing]]  by [[Toaplan]].

The correct translation is supposed to be "With the cooperation of Federation Forces, [[CATS (zero wing)|]] has taken over all of your bases." (JP: 連邦政府軍のご協力により、君達の基地は、全てCATSがいただいた).

title: kodachi
body:
The [b]kodachi[/b] (小太刀; "short sword") is a traditional Japanese sword that is similar in length to a [[wakizashi]], but is intended to be wielded as a primary weapon rather a companion to a [[katana]].  A kodachi typically has a slightly more curved blade and a longer grip (for two-handed use) compared to the wakizashi.  The typical purpose of the kodachi was to allow those not of the [[samurai]] class (and thus forbidden to carry a katana) to be armed.

h4. See also

* [[short sword]]
* [[ninjatou]]
* [[List of weapons]]

title: ninjatou
body:
The Ninjatou (忍者刀), also known as ninjaken (忍者剣) or shinobigatana (忍刀), is the most common name for the [[katana]] that the [[ninja]] were thought to have carried.  It is often depicted as being a [[short sword]], often portrayed as having a straight blade with a square tsuba. There is no historical evidence of the 'ninjatou', and modern depictions of the sword originate from portrayals that were seen in early Hollywood movies.

h4. See also

* [[short sword]]
* [[kodachi]]
* [[List of weapons]]

title: enjoji_jin
body: Jin, also known as Jiji, is a supporting character of the manga series [[Dandadan]]. He is [[Ayase Momo]]'s childhood friend, also unknowingly her first crush, who he lost touch with after moving away. Years later, he enrolls into [[Ayase Momo]]'s high school and reunites with her after he came to her grandmother for help to rid his house of the [[Evil Eye (Dandadan)|]] haunting him, which leads to him becoming the yokai's vessel. After the [[Evil Eye (Dandadan)|]] is kept under control by [[Takakura Ken (Dandadan)|]], Jiji becomes one of the few to lend his help to [[Ayase Momo]] and [[Takakura Ken (Dandadan)|]] as they try to find the latter's kintama.

title: lobco_(funamusea)
body:
Lobco is a humanoid lobster from [[Oounabara to Wadanohara|Wadanohara and the Great Blue Sea]]. She is one of [[Chlomaki (funamusea)|]]'s familiars and often goes off with her away from the sea.

Lobco has red, curly hair falling just below her shoulders. Four antennae like hairs stick out from the top of her head, two long and two short. Her eyes are dark red in game, but black in her official art. Her pupils are a lighter red.

Her shirt is black with eight yellow buttons on the front and two yellow stripes lining either side of the buttons. The cuffs of her sleeves are a dark gray. Her skirt is also black. In her game sprite a yellow line accents the edge of her skirt, but this is missing from her official art. A red chain can be seen hanging from the side of her skirt.

Lobco also wears dark gray tights, white gloves and long black boots with white laces.

title: super_gt
body:
A Japanese grand touring [[racing]] series, originally launched in 1993 as the [b]Zen Nihon GT Senshuken[/b] (aka [b]All Japan Grand Touring Car Championship[/b]).

There are two classes of [[racecar]] in Super GT, GT500 and GT300. The GT500 class is comprised of manufacturer supported teams from [[Toyota]], [[Nissan]], and [[Honda]] with purpose-built racecars loosely based on production vehicles featuring performance rivaling non-hybrid Le Mans Prototypes and largely equivalent to the Class 1 cars from [[Deutsche Tourenwagen Masters|DTM]]. GT300 is a more mixed class, featuring FIA GT3 spec vehicles from foreign manufacturers alongside Super GT's own JAF-GT spec vehicles.

Super GT is notable for being one of the few remaining major motorsport series to feature [[race queen]]s.

title: tareme
body:
Eyes drawn with the top eyelid slanted outwards, to the point where the outer corner of the eye is much lower than the inner corner. 
This usually produces a weak, gentle look and is generally given to characters with soft personalities (naturally, exceptions exist). Also known as a negative canthal tilt.

Opposite is [[tsurime]], which usually produces a strong, piercing look.

h4. Examples

* !post #5491998: [[Hiiragi Tsukasa|Tsukasa]] of [[Lucky Star]]
* !post #3133305: [[RO-500 (kancolle)|]] of [[Kantai Collection]]

h4. Related tags

* [[jitome]] - eyes topped with a flat line
* [[sanpaku]] - eyes that show white primarily above or below the iris
* tareme - eyes with a rounded, drooping shape
* [[tsurime]] - eyes with an upward outer "point"

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Eyes tags]]

title: tsurime
body:
Eyes drawn with the top eyelid slanting inwards. This usually produces a strong, piercing look and is generally given to characters with forceful personalities (naturally, exceptions exist). Also known as a positive canthal tilt or slanted eyes.

Opposite is [[tareme]], which usually produces a gentle, weak look.

h4. Examples

* !post #2510395: [[Hiiragi Kagami|Kagami]] of [[Lucky Star]]
* !post #2468323: [[Kashima (kancolle)|]] of [[Kantai Collection]]
* !post #7772503: Above - Tsurime, Below - Normal tilted eyes

h4. Related tags

* [[jitome]] - eyes topped with a flat line
* [[sanpaku]] - eyes that show white primarily above or below the iris
* [[tareme]] - eyes with a rounded, downturned shape
* tsurime - eyes with an upward outer "point"
* [[v-shaped eyes]]
* [[v-shaped eyebrows]]

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Eyes tags]]
