title: boeing_787
body:
A long-range twin-engine wide-body [[jet airliner|airliner]] that seats 210-330 passengers. Entering service in 2011 with [[All Nippon Airways]] as its launch customer, the Dreamliner has a lightweight fuselage made from composite materials and is powered by 2 high-bypass (better fuel efficiency) [[jet engine|turbofan engines]] with distinctive chevron-shaped exhausts for noise reduction. It also features only four cockpit windows rather than six. 

Inside, the [[cockpit|flight deck]] features a "glass cockpit":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glass_cockpit with digital displays, and the passenger cabin has improved pressurization (equivalent to that at about 1800 meters above sea level rather than 2500 meters) as well as enlarged windows with electronic dimming rather than manual pull-down shades.

The Dreamliner has had a troubled history (although no hull losses, "unlike its main competitor":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Haneda_Airport_runway_collision]), with it's maiden flight being delayed by two years, its first delivery being delayed by three years, and a project cost overrun of about $10 Billion USD. In 2013, the aircraft was "grounded by the FAA":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2013_Boeing_787_Dreamliner_grounding after two incidents of fires breaking out onboard that were caused by faulty lithium-ion [[battery|batteries]] which Boeing had outsourced.

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]
* [[Airbus A350]], the 787's main competitor

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Boeing 787":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boeing_787

title: shi_ci_dong_wu_cheng
body:
The 诗词动物城 "Animal Poetry City" comic series reimagines the lives of famous Chinese poets as anthropomorphic animals, blending humor, vibrant illustrations, and literary history. Each book in the series introduces a legendary poet, such as Li Bai, presenting their works and life stories in a fun and accessible way. Created by the popular artist 我是小魔 "I'm Xiao Mo," the series aims to make traditional Chinese culture and poetry engaging for readers of all ages, especially younger audiences. Through its unique storytelling, the series brings classic literature to life in a fresh and creative format.

<tn>Please note that there's no official English name yet by the time writing this wiki, and there's only one book about Li Bai. </tn>

Her original [[voice actor|voice actress]] [[Tsuru Hiromi]] passed away in November 2017, and was replaced by [[Hisakawa Aya]].

title: shin_(dragon_ball)
body:
Character in [[Dragon Ball]], first appearing in [[Dragon Ball Z]]'s [[Majin Buu|Buu]] Saga. The East and Head [[Kaioushin]] of Universe 7, he and his attendant [[Kibito]] come to Earth to warn of Majin Buu's arrival. Often referred to as just [b]Shin[/b] after he appears.

He is often depicted as being short with either [[pink skin|pink]] or [[purple skin]] with [[pointy ears]] and [[white hair]] styled in a [[mohawk]].

[Spoilers]In [[Dragon Ball Daima]], it is revealed that he has two siblings: [[Degesu]] and [[Dr. Arinsu]]. Additionally, it is revealed that Shin's true name is [b]Nahare[/b].[/spoilers]

h4. See also

* [[Kibitoshin]]

title: vegeta
body:
A major character in the [[Dragon Ball]] franchise, first introduced in [i][[Dragon Ball Z]][/i].  Vegeta made his appearance in chapter #204 "Sayonara, Son Goku", published in Weekly Shōnen Jump magazine on January 7, 1989, seeking the wish-granting Dragon Balls to achieve immortality.

Prince of the Saiyan race, and the main villain of the Saiyan arc before becoming a reluctant ally of the heroes during the Frieza arc. His family and home world was destroyed by [[Frieza]], and was forced to serve under his wing, until he met and fought against [[Son Goku]].

He always refers to Goku by his Saiyan name "Kakarot", who he regarded as his rival. He later becomes a full ally of the Z-Fighters after the Cell arc, marries [[Bulma]] and together they had two children, [[Trunks (dragon ball)|]] and [[Bra (dragon ball)|]]. Some of his most famous techniques are [[Big Bang Attack]], [[Final Flash]] and [[Galick Gun]].

Voiced by Christopher Sabat in English dub, René García in the latin american spanish dub and [[Horikawa Ryou]] in the Japanese version.

h4. See also
* [[It's over 9000 (meme)]]

title: ruyi
body:
A ruyi (Chinese: 如意; lit. 'as desired', 'as [you] wish') is a Chinese curved decorative object that serves as either a ceremonial scepter in Chinese Buddhism or a talisman symbolizing power and good fortune in Chinese folklore. The "ruyi" image frequently appears as a motif in Asian art.

title: shinano_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] [[aircraft carrier]] [i]Shinano[/i]. 
Character design by [[Soaryuna]], voiced by [[Noto Mamiko]].

Shinano was introduced in Azur Lane as the first UR (Ultra-Rare) ship of the roster, by way of the [i]Dreamwaker's Butterfly[/i] event on September 17, 2020.

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]] with [[fox]] features ([[fox ears|ears]] and [[fox tail|tail]]), and [[purple eyes]]. Her outfit is a traditional blue-white [[kimono]] with a [[white skirt]] and white [[thighhighs]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life [[flight deck]] with several 25 mm triple AA mounts and 12 cm 28-tube rocket launchers on each side, while she has three [[katana]] on a hull accessory to her back. She also has [[moon phases]] floating around her as a reference to her in-lore ability to [spoilers]see across multiple timelines[/spoilers] and the fact that she was historically sunk at night/early morning.

h4. Skins

title: shin_getter-1
body:
The main form of [[Shin Getter Robo]], primarily piloted by [[Nagare Ryoma]]. It resembles a taller, bulkier [[Getter-1]] with pupils in its eyes (that move, horrifyingly enough), and behaves like it's alive at times. It possesses large bat-like wings called the Getter Battle Wing, a large imposing Getter Tomahawk (that looks more like a halberd), capable of transforming into a scythe and lance respectively, the ability to fire powerful Getter beams from the head and the abdomen, and the ability to merge with enemy machines. Its most powerful attack is the mighty [[Stoner Sunshine]].

[spoiler]Its ultimate fate was it's merging with the planet [[Mars_(Planet)|Mars]], becoming the [[Getter Emperor]].[/spoiler]

title: tank_turret
body:
A type of turret designed to be mounted on a ground [[military vehicle]], often but not exclusively a [[tank]].

Tank turrets are generally compact and low profile, smaller than naval turrets, typically seating one to three crew members. The single main [[gun]] or [[cannon]] is usually centrally-mounted and of small or medium-caliber, often 20-125mm. May also feature additional coaxial or top-mounted armament,  mostly [[machine gun]]s but occasionally smaller cannons. Tank turrets are usually fully enclosed and designed to withstand hits from anti-tank cannons and/or missiles, but can be lightly armored, open topped, or open on one or more sides. Often features a [[tank cupola|cupola]], other observation devices, and [[hatch]]es. 

This tag can be applied when only the turret is present or visible, without the rest of the vehicle, and/or when a [[mecha]], [[personification]], or other character wears or uses a tank turret as a weapon.

[b]Do not[/b] use this tag for posts only featuring a [[tank cupola|cupola]] or [[hatch]], only use if the turret structure is visible. 

h4. Examples

* !post #6759248: Typical modern turret with characters sitting in cupolas and hatches, and a top-mounted machine gun.
* !post #4989651: Though not very low profile, this is still a tank turret.
* !post #2360571: This post contains a turret and hatches, but not the whole tank.
* !post #3736935: Similarly, turrets used or worn by personifications count.
* !post #3804177

h4. See also
* [[manually-operated mounted gun]]
* [[armored vehicle]]
* [[list of ground vehicles]]

title: viewfinder
body:
A camera frame. A set of lines in the corners of an image, used by a camera to frame a person being photographed.

In fanart, camera frames are usually used to indicate the person is being photographed or video recorded. If there is a red ' ●REC ' or similar icon in the corner, add the [[recording]] tag too.

Camera frames are usually used by older [[camera]]s and [[camcorder]]s, that had a separate physical viewfinder for the eye. They're less common in modern smartphones.

h4. See also
* [[Different viewfinder]]
* [[Facial recognition]]
* [[Fake phone screenshot]]
* [[Finger frame]]
* [[Picture frame]]
* [[Tag Group:Image Composition]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Viewfinder":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viewfinder]

title: vostroyan_firstborns
body:
[[Astra Militarum]] military faction in [[Warhammer 40K]]. Hailing from the planet Vostroya, the Firstborn are raised from the collected first-born sons (and now, daughters) of every Vostroyan family, no matter their status. They specialize in urban and winter warfare. The Firstborn are based visually on the real-world Russian Cossacks and the Tsarist Russian Army, as opposed to the [[Valhallan Ice Warriors]], which are based on the Soviet Red Army. 

h4. External links
* https://wh40k.lexicanum.com/wiki/Vostroyan_Firstborn

title: roan_(ragnarok_the_animation)
body: Protagonist of [i][[Ragnarok the Animation]][/i].

title: valhallan_ice_warriors
body:
[[Astra Militarum]] military faction in [[Warhammer 40K]]. Valhallan Ice Warriors are known for their ferocity and determination even in the face of overwhelming odds and extreme losses, and are experts at winter, mountain, attritional, and anti-Ork warfare. Famously, Hero [[Commissar]] Ciaphas Cain began his career alongside Valhallan units. Visually, the Valhallan Ice Warriors are based off the Soviet Union's Red Army, as opposed to the [[Vostroyan Firstborns]], which are based off the Russian Cossacks and Tsarist era. 

h4. External links
* https://wh40k.lexicanum.com/wiki/Valhallan_Ice_Warriors

title: decorating_christmas_tree
body: Decorating a [[Christmas tree]] with decorations like [[Christmas ornaments]], [[Christmas lights]], and [[garland (decoration)|]].

title: armageddon_steel_legion
body:
[[Astra Militarum]] military faction in [[Warhammer 40K]]. Hailing from the highly industrialized Hive Planet of Armageddon, the Steel Legion are heavily mechanized, but unusually not due to a partnership with the Mechanicus. They have been heavily engaged against Orks since the arrival of a large Waagh against their planet, and have become very skilled in fighting against them. Visually, they tend to resemble World War Two era motorized forces. 

h4. External links
https://wh40k.lexicanum.com/wiki/Armageddon_Steel_Legion

title: kuroyoru_umidori
body:
Character from [[Toaru Majutsu no Index]]. She likes [[stuffed dolphin]]s. Has a comical rivalry with [[Kinuhata Saiai]] and is often the target of [[Misaka Worst]]'s pranks.

She has [[black eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[sidelocks]] that transition to [[blonde hair|blonde]].  She typically wears a [[white coat|white]] [[hood]]ed [[trench coat]] on her [[coat on head|head]] with the [[hood up]] and her arms out of the sleeves, a [[black shirt|black]] and [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless]] [[crop top]] that leaves her [[bare shoulders|shoulders]], [[midriff]], and [[navel]] bare.  She wears [[black pants|black]] [[lowleg pants]], and [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves|elbow-length]] [[bridal gauntlets]], as well as [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. The sides of her top and gloves, and inner pant legs feature [[lace-up|laces]].

She has the ability to equip a [[mechanical arms|large number of robotic hands]] and use them to fire lances of nitrogen.

h4. External links

* "Toaru Majutsu no Index Wiki: Kuroyoru Umidori":[https://toarumajutsunoindex.fandom.com/wiki/Kuroyoru_Umidori]

title: ryuuhou_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Ryuuhou[/i]. Character designed by [[Tony Taka]]. 
First introduced in the [i]Swirling Cherry Blossoms[/i] event in December 2019 (one of her skills lends its name to the event).

In her base form, she is shown wearing a black [[double-breasted]] [[military uniform]] with a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] orange print [[haori]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied in a [[ponytail]] and [[bangs]] swept to her right, [[large breasts]], and [[pink horns]].

She is also shown with a [[katana]]-[[wakizashi]] [i]daishou[/i] pair attached to her [[belt]]. Her way to launch aircraft is via [[ofuda]] talismans, similar in principle to an [[onmyouji]].

h4. Skins

* !post #3729037: Default
* !post #6309339:  [[Ryuuhou (Firebird's New Year Dance) (azur lane)|Firebird's New Year Dance]]
* !post #5910165:  [[Ryuuhou (Queen of Whales) (Azur Lane)|Queen of Whales]] (unreleased)

h4. See also
* [[Ryuuhou (Kancolle)]]

h4. External links

title: royal_fortune_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the fourth sailing frigate named [i]Royal Fortune[/i], under the command of the Welsh pirate [[Bartholomew Roberts (fate)|]]. She is the first sailing ship in Azur Lane, and currently the second oldest ship depicted in-game.

h4. Appearance

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], [[red eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit is piratical in theme, consisting of a [[torn clothes|torn]] [[white dress]], [[red skirt]], [[pirate hat]], [[black jacket]], [[pantyhose]], and black [[boots]], with a [[sword]] slung to her left side. 

h4. History
Originally the sailing frigate [i]Onslow[/i], she was captured by Roberts on 8 August 1721 and renamed in honor of three previous raiders named the [i]Royal Fortune[/i], and this was the ship under Roberts' command when he was killed in action on 10 February 1722 off the African coast by a [[Royal Navy]] ship.

title: primarch
body:
Major characters in the [[Warhammer 40k]] setting, the Primarchs were 20 beings created from scratch by the [[Emperor of Mankind]] and whose genes would be used as the basis for the biological modifications given to each legion of [[adeptus astartes|Space Marines]]. [spoiler]Many would die or vanish following the treason of one of their own, Horus, and the subsequent civil war. Meanwhile, Robute Guilliman, Primarch of the [[Ultramarines]], would return to the setting and become one of its principal characters.[/spoiler] h4. List of primarchs. Note [[Alpharius Omegon]] was split into "demi primarchs" [[Alpharius]] and [[Omegon]]. In universe the II'th and XI'th Legion were censured for unknown reasons with some fans creating their own concepts. Fan made interpretations are [[Lost Primarch]]s.

title: ranger_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the US Navy (light) aircraft carrier, USS [i]Ranger[/i] (CV-4), in [[Azur Lane]]. 
Character design by [[Enka (bcat)]], voiced by [[Asakawa Yuu]].

h4. Description
h5. Base Art

Ranger has long reddish-[[pink hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a white [[tank top]] with reddish-[[pink skirt|pink]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]] with a horizontal white stripe around it with "RNGR" on her left, a reference to her real-life pre-war identification marks. She has a [[black jacket]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[detached sleeves]], and [[black thighhighs]]. In addition, she wears
[[pink_gloves|pink]], [[partially fingerless gloves]], [[elbow gloves]] where the index finger is full covered, the middle finger is covered up to the first digit from the knuckle, and the ring and pinkie fingers are uncovered. She also has a [[headset]] with a [[microphone]] on her left side, a [[blue_bag|blue]] [[messenger bag]], and a [[choker]] with an [[anchor]] hanging from the front. She has very [[large breasts]] that sometimes get made bigger in what fanart she gets.

Her [[rigging]] is her ship model turned into a large [[crossbow]]-styled launcher. It is about 3/4 of her height, with a trigger about mid-ship on port-side. Her island superstructure is featured, alongside anti-air batteries, and a [[radar dish]]. She has a [[badge]] on her bag, which is her real life crew's badge.

h5. Retrofit Art
[tn]See post #2930385[/tn]

In her [[retrofit (azur lane)|]], her outfit gets swapped for white [[front-tie top]], a pair of [[uneven legwear|asymmetrical]] [[tight pants]] where the left leg is wrapped with black leather strips, and a jacket-esque [[cape]]. She sports a new [[flat cap]] with a white top and red beak, and some [[armored boots]].  Her already [[large breasts]] get more emphasize if not an actual increase.

Her rigging loses the crossbow aesthetic and moves the trigger and handle aft.

h5. Personality and In-game Trivia
Ranger takes on a role of a teacher, similar to [[Langley (Azur Lane)|]], treating the Commander as one of her students. She gets easily flustered, stuttering and getting embarrassed in several of her lines, with a number of things suggesting some desire for her students.

Her plane loadout is purely dive bombers (like her real-life counterpart). Her skillset is particularly RNG dependent, leading to potentially hilarious damage output.

h4. History
In real life, [i]Ranger[/i] was the US Navy's first carrier designed and built from scratch, providing valuable training experience to Naval aviators for the likelihood of war. In World War II, she primarily saw combat in the Atlantic and Mediterranean theaters as her comparatively slow speed, minimal armor, and limited plane capacity prevented her from seeing service in the Pacific other than training duties from 1944 onward. She was decommissioned in 1946 and sold for scrap a year later.

title: black_legion
body:
The [b]Black Legion[/b] is the largest warband of [[Chaos Space Marine]]s in [[Warhammer_40k|Warhammer 40k]] universe. [spoiler]Formed after the defeat of the [[sons_of_horus|Sons of Horus]] in the Horus Heresy and their retreat in the Eye of Terror, [/spoiler]the Legion was founded by [spoiler]former Sons of Horus First Captain [/spoiler][[Abbadon_the_Despoiler|Abbadon the Despoiler]] during the feuds among traitor legions known as the Legion Wars. It includes a substantial portion of the former [spoiler]Sons of Horus [/spoiler]alongside some [[Space_Marine|Space Marines]] from other traitor legions. The Black Legion sees itself [spoiler]not as the successor of [[Horus_Lupercal|Horus]] and his Legion, but [/spoiler]as a new army to continue the Long War against the [[Imperium_of_man|Imperium]] and succeed where their predecessors failed.
The warriors of the legion wear [[black_armor|black]] [[power_armor|power armor]], decorated with [[gold]] and [[Chaos_Undivided_(symbol)|symbols]] of the [[Chaos_Undivided|Chaos Undivided]] they worship.

title: luna_wolves
body:
The [b]Luna Wolves[/b] were the XVIth [[Space_Marine|Space Marine]] Legion raised by the [[Emperor_of_Mankind|Emperor of Mankind]] in [[Warhammer_40k|Warhammer 40k]]. Founded on Terra ([[Earth_(planet)|Earth]]) at the dawn of the Great Crusade in the late 30th Millennium. After the Emperor rediscovered the Legion's [[primarch]] [[Horus_Lupercal|Horus]] in 801.M30 on the world of Cthonia, and gave him command of the Luna Wolves, Horus went on to lead the XVIth Legion in earning thousands of battle honours over the span of the 200 standard years of the Great Crusade.
Primarch renamed the legion from the Luna Wolves to the [[Sons_of_Horus|Sons of Horus]][spoiler] shortly before his fall into [[Chaos_(Warhammer)|Chaos]] and the start of the Heresy[/spoiler]. 
The Luna Wolves wore [[White_armor|white]] [[power_armor|power armour]], a [[roman_empire|Roman-inspired]] centurion helmet and the legion's symbol of a [[wolf]]'s head with a [[crescent moon]] (commemorates the conquest of the [[Moon]], the campaign that gave the legion its name). After reuniting with their Primarch, they also added his [[eyes_of_horus_(warhammer_40k)|eye symbol]] on their armour.

title: anti-chan_(nuelogical)
body:
A derivative of [[orenjipiiru]]'s original character "[[Child GF (orenji)|]]". She originates from user "notsleepypilled":[https://twitter.com/intent/user?user_id=1734075015157702656]'s attempt to repurpose [[nuelogical]]'s design of Child GF (post #7496962) into a character that made fun of Lolicon types, which instead had the opposite effect with [[anti-chan (nuelogical)|]] adopting a [[mesugaki]] personality and becoming a mockery of those who are critical of Lolicon instead.

In contrast with orenji's original design, she wears a [[blue shirt]] (often a [[print shirt]] with the words "KYS" or "NO UOH!"), and a [[yellow hat|yellow]] [[sun hat]] with a [[blue bow]] representing the colors of the [[crying emoji]] which is strongly associated with the [[uohhhhhhhhh! (meme)|]] meme.

title: portland_(azur_lane)
body:
Azur Lane's personification of the American heavy cruiser [i]Portland[/i], drawn by [[Saru]]. Her younger [[sisters|sister]] is [[Indianapolis_(azur_lane)|]].

Portland's appearance consists of light [[purple hair]] done in a [[side ponytail]] and sporting a [[heart ahoge]], [[blue eyes]] with [[heart-shaped pupils]], a [[skin fang]], and [[large_breasts|large breasts]]. She wears a [[black bikini]] [[bikini top only|top]] showing [[cleavage]] and an [[off shoulder]] [[blue shirt]] with a [[black sailor collar]]. She also wears a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[black skirt|black]] [[miniskirt]] with [[uneven legwear]], usually a [[white thighhighs|white thighhigh]] and a [[white socks|white sock]] with [[grey footwear|grey]] [[shoes]]. 

The most distinctive part of her, however, is her personality. Portland displays intensive [[siscon]]/[[incest]] tendencies towards [[indianapolis_(azur_lane)|Indianapolis]], referring to her in virtually every single line she has. In addition, she is shown holding multiple doujinshi of her beloved "Indy-chan". She likely outdoes Kantai Collection's [[ooi (kancolle)|Ooi]] in terms of obsessiveness over her sister ship.

For her retrofit form, see her [[Portland (retrofit) (azur lane)|corresponding page.]]

title: indianapolis_(azur_lane)
body:
The "USS [i]Indianapolis[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Indianapolis (CA-35) as personified and portrayed in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i]. Her older [[sisters|sister]] is [[Portland (azur lane)|]].

She was designed by [[Saru]] and is voiced by Yokota Aya.

As with the other shipgirls who bear the namesake with Native American-related places, she is a [[dark-skinned female|dark-skinned]] girl with [[very long hair|very long]] light [[pink hair|pink]] [[twintails]] with a [[heart ahoge]] and [[heterochromia|heterochromatic]] eyes - the left [[yellow eyes|yellow]], the right [[blue eyes|blue]]. She has [[facepaint]] underneath her eyes and her [[covered mouth|mouth is covered]] by a metallic [[turtleneck]]. Her attire is comprised of [[white thighhighs|white]] [[uneven legwear]], a white [[underboob]]-exposing [[white bandeau|bandeau]], [[partially fingerless gloves|partly fingerless]] [[black gloves]], [[mechanical horns]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] takes shape as two gigantic [[mechanical arms]] mounted on her upper back.

She most notably sits on top of the [[Fat Man (bomb)|]] [[nuclear weapon|atomic bomb]], in reference to how she was used to transport the component of the Fat Man in real life. Eventually the [[radiation symbol]] on her nuke was replaced with a cutesy devil face for untranslated reasons even though both the Japanese and Chinese playerbase took no offense to its presence and even seemed to resent the change.

title: pompeo_magno_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the Capitani Romani (Roman Captain)-class light cruiser/destroyer [i]Pompeo Magno[/i] in [[Azur Lane]].

Historically commissioned under the Roman Captain name as a light cruiser in 1943, she was surrendered to the Allies just three months later in the Armistice of Cassibile.
Post-war, she and one of her sisters ([i]Giulio Germanico[/i]) were retained by the new Italian Navy and underwent a reconstruction program that saw them reclassed as destroyer leaders and refitted with a weapons suite similar to [[Allen M. Sumner (Azur Lane)|]] and her sisters (namely, three twin 127 mm mounts albeit hers was two mounts aft while Sumner's was two mounts fore). In addition, she was renamed [i]San Giorgio[/i] (pennant D562).

Named after the Roman general Pompey the Great.

title: kinki_no_magna
body:
[i]Forbidden Magna[/i]

A strategy RPG that released in 2014 exclusively for the [[nintendo_3ds|Nintendo 3DS]]. Called "Lord of Magna: Maiden Heaven" internationally.

It's development was originally started by Neverland, the studio behind the [[rune_factory|Rune Factory]] series, but the game's development was ultimately finished by [[marvelous|Marvelous]] following Neverland's bankrupcy in 2013.

title: peter_strasser_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the second [i]Graf Zeppelin[/i]-class aircraft carrier, named in honor of the [[Imperial German Navy]]'s commander of the airship fleet in [[World War I]]. Character design by [[Gujianshaonu]], voiced by [[Hara Yumi]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] tied in [[twintails]], and [[purple eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a white [[peaked cap]], a [[double-breasted]] two-tone [[military uniform]] with a long black strap, [[white gloves]], and [[high heels]].

As for her [[rigging]], she combines the animalistic sentient rig style of the Ironblood faction with the split-deck design of the [[Essex (Azur Lane)|]]-class. It is also themed like clockwork, as she stands on a floating clock and has red-colored gears surrounding her, which leads players to note similarities with [[Tokisaki Kurumi]] down to her own hairstyle.

In real life, [i]Peter Strasser[/i] was built in 1938 but work stopped in September 1939 in order to prioritize construction of U-boats and never resumed, ultimately being scrapped on the slipway the following year. In any case, her intended flight deck arresting gear and catapults ended up being purchased by the [[Regia Marina]] to complete [[Aquila (Azur Lane)|]].

title: sons_of_horus
body:
The [b]Sons of Horus[/b] is the XVIth Legion of [[Space_Marine|Space Marines]] in [[Warhammer_40k|Warhammer 40k]], was originally known as the [[Luna_Wolves|Luna Wolves]]. In honour of their [[Primarch]] [[Horus_Lupercal|Horus]]' great achievements during Great Crusade, after the Ullanor triumph his father, the [[Emperor_of_Mankind|Emperor of Mankind]] suggested that the Legion be renamed the "Sons of Horus" and the Primarch, at his brother [[Sanguinius]]' urging, did it some time later. 
[spoiler]Shortly after the Legion's renaming, Horus was corrupted by the [[Chaos_(Warhammer)|Chaos Gods]] and started a rebellion against his father known as the Horus Heresy. At the start of the Heresy, one third of the loyal to the [[Imperium_of_Man|Imperium]] Sons of Horus were killed during the lstvaan III massacre, the remainder supported the Primarch in his war against the Emperor, and become the [[Chaos_Space_Marine|Chaos_Space_Marines]][/spoiler]
[spoiler]After their defeat at the Battle of Terra, the Sons of Horus escaped with the other Traitor Legions into the Eye of Terror, where they fell apart to many warbands until the Legion's First Captain [[Abbadon_the_Despoiler|Ezekyle Abaddon]] united most of them into the [[Black_Legion|Black Legion]].[/spoiler]
The Sons of Horus wore [[Green_armor|green]] or [[Black_armor|black]] [[power_armor|power armor]], [[pickelhaube|spiked helmets]] and their Primarch's [[eyes_of_horus_(warhammer_40k)|eye symbol]].

title: hekapoo
body:
[b]Hekapoo[/b] is a character who appears in the [[Disney]] animated series [[Star vs the Forces of Evil]]. She is the forger of Dimensional Scissors and one of the members of the Magic High Commission. She is voiced by "Zosia Mamet":[https://starvstheforcesofevil.fandom.com/wiki/Zosia_Mamet].

Hekapoo has pale [[white skin]], [[spiked arm]]s, [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]] (tied back in a black spiky [[hair tie]]) with bangs that cover her right eye, [[orange eyes]], [[fangs]], [[pointy ears|pointed ears]], and yellow-orange [[horns]]. She primarily wears a yellow-orange ballgown, brown [[high heel boots]], and a [[black tiara|black]] [[tiara]]. A small orange flame constantly burns over her head.

body:

She has a [[long hair|long]]/[[medium hair|medium]] [[red hair]] styled in [[ponytail]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her katana is Kujikanesada and she use Kurama-ryu as her fighting style.

body:
PT Indomarco Prismatama or Indomaret (short for Indonesia Market Retail) is a chain of retail [[convenience store]]s from Indonesia, with over 21,900 stores in 32 provinces across Indonesia. title: horus_lupercal
body:
[[Warhammer 40K]] character. [[Primarch]] of the XVIth [[adeptus_astartes|Legiones Astartes]], the [[Sons_of_Horus|Sons of Horus]] (originally known as the [[Luna_Wolves|Luna Wolves]]).
[spoiler]Corrupted by the [[Chaos_(warhammer)|Chaos forces]], he betrayed his father, the [[Emperor_of_Mankind|Emperor of Mankind]], and started a devastating civil war within the [[Imperium_of_Man|Imperium of Man]] known as the Horus Heresy.[/spoiler]
[quote]
By the time of the Heresy, Horus was equipped with the gigantic Power Maul [[Worldbreaker (warhammer 40k)|]], said to be constructed by the Emperor's own hands. His right arm wielded the Talon of Horus, a monstrous [[clawed gauntlets|Power Claw]] constructed for him as a gift by the Dark Mechanicum's Fabricator-General Kelbor-Hal. Originally, he fought with a Power Sword and Twin-Linked Bolter.[16] Horus wore an enormous suit of Terminator [[power armor|Armour]] known as [[the Serpent's Scales (warhammer)|]].
[/quote]

title: sousaphone
body:
A type of [[tuba]] with conical tubing that is widely used in [[marching band|marching bands]]. It is designed in a way that fits around the body of the tubist. While the valves are near chest level, the bell is above the player's head. It was developed in the 1890s by one J.W. Pepper at the request of John Philip Sousa (1854–1932), the legendary American marching band director and composer, who wanted a tuba that was easier and more comfortable to march with than the types then in common use.

title: anica_domazet
body:
Anica Domazet (callsign "Thompson") is a female Croatian character, created in 2024 by LapisLumos and designed by [[Chen Feng (slbdofcl)|]].

She owes her callsign to the Croatian group "Thompson", and her first name to their song "Anica − Kninska kraljica".

She is [[Zarya Petrovic|Skorpion]]'s love interest.

title: darya_karamazova
body:
Darya Karamazova (callsign "Dasha") is a female Russian character, created by LapisLumos in 2024 and designed by [[Chen Feng (slbdofcl)|]].

She's a veteran of the First and Second Chechen Wars.

She was designed as the unofficial mother of [[Marichka]] to a Ukrainian father.

title: fusion_dance
body:
[i]Fuuuu...[/i]sion [b]HAAAAAAAA![/b]

A special technique in [[Dragon Ball]] where two beings of similar builds and power levels perform an awkward symmetrical dance that, when performed correctly, will result in [[fusion|a fused being]] typically more powerful than the two dancers. Though the fused being will be eventually de-fused and returned back to two individuals some time later.

The final pose of the dance shows both participants facing the same direction, a few feet apart, leaning towards each other with extended arms and index fingers meeting.

The form that manifests from the dance, if series-accurate, is seen wearing a [[Metamoran vest]], a black waistcoat-reminiscent vest with a yellow padding-like collar. 

h4. Example

* !post #983444

h4. See also

* [[potara earrings]]
* [[fusion]]
* [[gattai]]

It mostly consists of a [[shirt|frilled-short sleeved red shirt]], a [[skirt|high-waist black skirt]], a [[belt|spiked black belt]], a [[thigh strap|spiked thigh strap]] and [[thigh strap|belt strap]] a [[collar|spiked black collar]] with a [[chain]] on it, [[asymmetrical legwear|fishnet and torn black thighhighs]], a [[anklet|spiked anklet]], [[bracelet|spiked bracelets]] and [[boots|red boots]]. Her orange streaks, eyes and the flames on her tail and in her ears are all changed to [[alternate color|blue]].
